label: Java Development
description:
Can't connect to SQL Server 2014 Express AMI
Hello,

When I use the RDP session I only see one Command Prompt window.  I don't see a Windows UI.  Is this AMI bad?

Additionally, I'm trying to remotely connect to the SQL Server that is provided by this AMI.  I have all ports inbound ports open but I can't figure out how to remotely connect and configure it.  I can connect to it locally in the RDP session.

Is there a default port for this SQL instance?  

https://aws.amazon.com/marketplace/pp/B00KQP3H7W?qid=1550514839796&sr=0-8&ref_=srh_res_product_title#pdp-support

Thanks!

Zach

label: Java Development
description:
Re: Can't connect to SQL Server 2014 Express AMI
The AMI contains Windows Server Core Install : https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/hh846323(v=vs.85).aspx, so seeing only Command Prompt is expected.

By default the network services are disabled on SQL Server. Need to restart network services to be able to reach SQL Server (port 1443) from outside server.

Following is the way to enable the networking service:
1. Use netstat -a -b to verify port 1433 is not LISTENING
2. Run C:\Windows\SysWOW64\SQLServerManager12.msc from cmd.exe to open SQL Server 2014 Configuration Manager
3. Follow Steps in Microsoft Article   https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/sql/database-engine/configure-windows/enable-or-disable-a-server-network-protocol?view=sql-server-2017  to check the network status, enable, and restart SQL Server
4. After SQL Server restart, check for port status using netstat -a -b
5. Should be able to connect from other servers after that, off course assuming the port is allowed.

Hope this helps.

label: Java Development
description:
Re: Can't connect to SQL Server 2014 Express AMI
Perfect response!  Thank you so much.  That's very helpful.

label: Java Development
description:
Re: Can't connect to SQL Server 2014 Express AMI
Is there a set of default credentials for remote server management?

I can telnet to the port 1433 and that responds so I know the server is running.  I'm not able to figure out the default credentials using the remote management server tool so I can't log in to begin adding databases, etc.

description:
How to use SageMaker model from marketplace with GPU instances
Hi, I subscribed to the GluonCV YOLOv3 Object Detector https://aws.amazon.com/marketplace/pp/prodview-5jlvp43tsn3ny model at the Marketplace but when I try to create a batch transform job with this model on a GPU accelerated instance type (ml.p2.*) the console returns me the following error: "Requested instance type cannot work with all containers of the model". How can I use this model with GPU instances?

label: Java Development
description:
Re: How to use SageMaker model from marketplace with GPU instances
Currently, the listing https://aws.amazon.com/marketplace/pp/prodview-5jlvp43tsn3ny does not support GPUs. You can find the instance types currently supported for batch transform on the "Subscribe to this software” page of the listing, which appears when you click on the “Continue to Subscribe” button on the listing page.

label: Java Development
description:
Is CustomerIdentifier always unique per user?
In the following guide (https://docs.aws.amazon.com/marketplace/latest/userguide/configuring-your-saas-application-to-accept-new-customers.html), ResolveCustomer is used to get CustomerIdentifier and ProductCode.

Is CustomerIdentifier is always associated to a single AWS user?

I.e. does CustomerIdentifier always mean an individual, or can it also resolve to an organization that individual belongs to? In other words, can two different AWS users ever have the same CustomerIdentifier?

Thank you,
Alex

label: Java Development
description:
Re: Is CustomerIdentifier always unique per user?
CustomerIdentifier is associated with a single AWS account. If multiple users share the same AWS account (through IAM roles, for example), yes, they will share the same CustomerIdentifier.

label: Java Development
Java Development
description:
Re: China resources
Hi,

We'd be happy to help as these are common challenges - downloading from foreign mirrors (wait until you try NPM) is a challenge - on your other issues:

1. `apt-get install maven` took about 2-3 hours to download all dependencies;

Yes - careful mirror selection is critical here; there are some choices.

2. `mvn build` hangs on downloading Maven/Java dependencies;

Best to mirror  - we also do local caching on Jenkins some times for this.

3. an `ssh` connection to EC2 in CN too slow - can't even type commands (I'm writing them in a text editor, and then copy-paste to the terminal).

This is usually a routing issue - try going indirectly to Korea or Japan or if in Europe, Singapore first then to Bejing - can make a huge difference.

We help lots of companies with these challenges as the only China-based AWS MSP, so feel free to contact me.

Steve Mushero, CEO
ChinaNetCloud - Only China-Based AWS MSP
www.ChinaNetCloud.com

label: Java Development
description:
AWS Status page improvement (JSON and CORS support)
I m using several cloud provider to operate my application and need to retrieve information from all my providers. To do that I use their “status page” like :
http://status.aws.amazon.com/
https://status.cloud.google.com/
…

I retrieve from them the list of incidents as a JSON stream. Here is the Example for google :
https://status.cloud.google.com/incidents.json

When I tried to do the same for AWS I run into several issue. First the JSON URL is hard to find so I think it should be added on the status page (see how google do it). 
After I find the JSON URL : http://status.aws.amazon.com/data.json I had error to retrieve data from it because of CORS.

It would be much easier if this page which is public and aim to distribute information allow CORS from all domain (like Google do with the CORS allow all header).

I hope AWS will take that into consideration to improve the experience for developers.

Cheers, Charles

label: Java Development
description:
Re: AWS Status page improvement (JSON and CORS support)
Here is the answer from the AWS engineer contacted through my company :

The JSON version of the AWS Status data that you found is actually an undocumented, internal API that the web page uses.
The official and supported programmatic way of getting AWS status information is to use the various RSS feeds that you see on the page to the right of the table entries.
As you can see, the RSS feed URLs follow a simple naming convention, so you don't need to copy paste them into a large table, instead, you can use any of the popular RSS feed parsers and a few for loops to cycle through all the regions and services that interest you and retrieve their status information.

I hope it can help some people.

description:
key pair in eclipse toolkit
Hi,I've setup the eclipse toolkit and it is listing my instance but the key pair has a big red 'x' next to its name.  I can also not connect to the instance via the eclipse toolkit. Everything works well in the aws console or elasticfox.  I have the keys in ~/.ec2/ in which they should be detected automatically. What am I missing?  How can I fix this?- Markus

label: Java Development
description:
Re: key pair in eclipse toolkit
Hey Markus,

that red 'x' definitely means the toolkit can't find your private key, just like you mentioned.  

There's two ways to take care of this:
 1 - ensure that the corresponding private keys live in ~/.ec2/ and that the file name is in the form "<key-name>.pem" .   It sounds like you've already got your keys in the right directory, so I'm guessing maybe they just have a different file extension?  Some private keys on windows/mac tend to use different extensions depending on which platform they're created for, so maybe the toolkit needs to be aware of that and accept other extensions, too.  If that's what's happening to you, i'll open a bug report so we can add that feature.

 2 - If you can get to EC2 Key Pair widget (in the Launch Wizard for example), you can right click on the key pair and click the "Select private key file" menu item to explicitly map a private key to a key pair.  I've got a change open to make it easier to get to that Key Pair widget from the preferences, but until that's submitted and built, you can find it on the Launch Wizard.

Let us know if that helps and if you have any other feedback,
j

label: Java Development
description:
AWS Toolkit for Eclipse: proxy problem
My computer is behind a NTLMv2 proxy so I succeeded in installing AWS Toolkit only after I disabled the ECF httpclient provider.Now, my attempts to test my connection to Simpledb service fail so I guess the problem is due to the presence of this proxy, but I have no Idea how I can workaround it: can you help me?Thanks

label: Java Development
description:
Re: AWS Toolkit for Eclipse: proxy problem
this sounds like a tricky one...  I had to search around for info on NTLM, and after searching I found the docs you must have found describing how to disable Apache HttpClient (which doesn't support NTLM), so that Eclipse uses URLConnection (which does support NTLM) when you use the Eclipse Update Manager:
http://wiki.eclipse.org/ECF_Filetransfer_Support_for_NTLMv2_Proxies

Once you get the plugin installed, it uses the AWS client libraries to community with Amazon SimpleDB, which relies on Apache HttpClient, which doesn't support NTLM.

There's not an easy way to change the AWS SimpleDB library to use an HTTP client that supports NTLM, but...

you could try using a free NTLM proxy like Cntlm:
http://cntlm.sourceforge.net/

with that, you should be able to start up the Cntlm proxy on your computer, and tell eclipse to use it as a proxy instead of directly hitting the NTLM proxy.  Cntlm acts as a SOCKS5 proxy, which Apache HttpClient does support.

Some more information ...If I set the socks proxy:System.setProperty("socksProxyHost", "proxy.mycompany.com");System.setProperty("socksProxyPort", "1234");I get a different type of error (but it is not an instant error). This makes me think this is an important setting to have. Instead of the error being that I cannot find the host the error is now...SEVERE: Unable to execute HTTP request: The host did not accept the connection within timeout of 50000 msException in thread "main" com.amazonaws.AmazonClientException: Unable to execute HTTP request: The host did not accept the connection within timeout of 50000 ms    at com.amazonaws.http.HttpClient.execute(HttpClient.java:185)    at com.amazonaws.services.ec2.AmazonEC2Client.invoke(AmazonEC2Client.java:2914)    at com.amazonaws.services.ec2.AmazonEC2Client.describeAvailabilityZones(AmazonEC2Client.java:309)    at com.amazonaws.services.ec2.AmazonEC2Client.describeAvailabilityZones(AmazonEC2Client.java:2466)    at AwsConsoleApp.main(AwsConsoleApp.java:124)Caused by: org.apache.commons.httpclient.ConnectTimeoutException: The host did not accept the connection within timeout of 50000 ms    at org.apache.commons.httpclient.protocol.ControllerThreadSocketFactory.createSocket(ControllerThreadSocketFactory.java:96)    at org.apache.commons.httpclient.protocol.SSLProtocolSocketFactory.createSocket(SSLProtocolSocketFactory.java:132)    at org.apache.commons.httpclient.HttpConnection.open(HttpConnection.java:706)    at org.apache.commons.httpclient.MultiThreadedHttpConnectionManager$HttpConnectionAdapter.open(MultiThreadedHttpConnectionManager.java:1321)    at org.apache.commons.httpclient.HttpMethodDirector.executeWithRetry(HttpMethodDirector.java:386)    at org.apache.commons.httpclient.HttpMethodDirector.executeMethod(HttpMethodDirector.java:170)    at org.apache.commons.httpclient.HttpClient.executeMethod(HttpClient.java:396)    at org.apache.commons.httpclient.HttpClient.executeMethod(HttpClient.java:324)    at com.amazonaws.http.HttpClient.execute(HttpClient.java:127)    ... 4 more

label: Java Development
description:
Re: AWS Toolkit for Eclipse: proxy problem
Hey Mark,

the very first thing I'd do is figure out exactly what your proxy settings are (i.e. SOCKS5 vs. HTTP, host, port, is a username/pass required, etc.)

For a SOCKS5 proxy, it looks like you already know what you're doing, but others reading this thread might find this link interesting: http://java.sun.com/javase/6/docs/technotes/guides/net/proxies.html

Next, check out the ClientConfiguration class in the AWS SDK for Java:
http://docs.amazonwebservices.com/AWSJavaSDK/latest/javadoc/com/amazonaws/ClientConfiguration.html

There are some additional proxy settings there, although from what I remember, for SOCKS proxies, setting the system properties should work.

Also in ClientConfiguration, you can set the default protocol (HTTP or HTTPS) clients will use to connect to AWS:
http://docs.amazonwebservices.com/AWSJavaSDK/latest/javadoc/com/amazonaws/ClientConfiguration.html#setProtocol(com.amazonaws.Protocol)

You could try changing that to Protocol.HTTP (the default is HTTPS) and see if that works better with your network configuration.

To use a custom ClientConfiguration object, just pass it in to the AmazonS3Client constructor when you create your client object.

hope that helps.  let us know how it goes,
j

label: Java Development
description:
reserved instance
Hello,

We decided to buy reserved instance m1.large windows server for three years term (Heavy Utilization Reserved Instance). And in your table it shows 1700$ / 3year.
I want to know 
is there  any other charges in addition to this $1700?
because table shows 0.16$/hour for windoews usage . what is this?

Regards
saravana

label: Java Development
description:
Re: reserved instance
Hi pixelsaravana,

That is your hourly rate.  Since you purchased a Heavy Utilization RI, you will pay this hourly rate regardless of whether you launch an instance with the covered RI parameters or not.

So for example in March there are 31 X 24 = 744 hours.  If the term of the RI covers the entire month of March, you would pay 744 X $0.16/hour or $119.04 in hourly charges.  

A One-Time up front non-refundable RI charge gives you the option to later run instances at lower hourly rates than list prices.  For Heavy RIs, you pay the hourly rates whether you run the an instance on the covered parameters or not.

Bronson

label: Java Development
description:
temporarily stopping an instance query
Hi folks,

I am a newbie to AWS and have been reading up on the tutorials etc. and wonder if someone could clarify the following points:

1. if I uploaded an application to the server, would it still be there if I temporarily stopped the service at close of business, only to open it the following day?

2. would I get charged for the downtime?

Thanks for your help.

Regards

G

label: Java Development
description:
Re: temporarily stopping an instance query
When you stop an EC2 instance, you will only be charged for the allocated storage. There are no other charges until you start the instance again. When the instance starts, your data is still there. Stopping an instance is like turning off your computer. However, the instance will get a new IP address upon boot.

label: Java Development
description:
Re: Firefox Extension for Amazon EC2 and Firefox 3.0
The "connect by SSH" button is magical. I had used the command line tools on a unix box to set up AWS, but Iwanted PuTTY to work through ElasticFox on my Windows machine. It wastrivially simple, once I figured out how to do it. It sure would benice to have this built into the documentation.1. Get the id_rsa-gsg-keypair that you generated from your .pems onto your Windows machine.2. Find and open PuTTYgen.exe - mine was not in the PATH but in C:\Program Files\PuTTY3. On the PuTTYgen "panel" in the "Actions" section press the bigbutton that says "Load" to load an existing private key file. Point itto your id_rsa-gsg-keypair.4. In the same part of the PuTTYgen interface, click on the big buttonthat says "Save in Private key" to save the generated key. 5. In the resulting dialog box, navigate to your home directory inC:\Documents and Settings[username] (not "My Documents" but thedirectory above it.). Make a directory called "ec2-keys" and finallysave the file as "gsg-keypair.ppk"6. You should now be able to connect to a listed instance with PuTTYssh by just pushing the magic button. Of course, this connects you as ROOT from within your WEB BROWSER so use your new terminal to change your root certificate and set up a user account with admin permissions. YOU HAVE BEEN WARNED!

label: Java Development
description:
How to transfer a domain name I own to Amazon (EC2)
Hi,

Can anyone tell me how I might go about transferring a domain from one host to my amazon account? I have launched an instance and can log into remote desktop. I want to upload my web application but am unsure how I am to link it to my domain which I need to transfer to AWS.

Help anyone? Thanks

label: Java Development
description:
Re: How to transfer a domain name I own to Amazon (EC2)
You don't transfer your domain name to AWS.  Rather allocate an Elastic IP address and the associate it to your instance.  Then go to your domain provider and point your domain to the Elastic IP address.  You don't need to transfer your domain to AWS.  You can do this from the AWS management console.In this way, you can start a second instance and test any application updates, then just move the Elastic IP to the second instance without having to make any changes with your domain provider.

label: Java Development
description:
Re: How to transfer a domain name I own to Amazon (EC2)

i am living in Italy, i would transfer my domain to Amazon(Ec2), how can i do?
i must use elastic ip?
is there different way to resorve this problem?

label: Java Development
description:
Re: How to transfer a domain name I own to Amazon (EC2)
As BrianW@AWS said, you don't transfer the domain name to AWS. They are not a domain registrar. What you want to do is modify the DNS records. If you haven't purchased a DNS service from a third party, then this is probably provided by your current domain registrar. You need to locate any web control panel they might have provided you with or ask them how to update DNS records.

Let's say you want to host your domain www.example.com at AWS. First you launch an EC2 instance, and configure it according to your requirements. In this example you might want to serve web pages for www.example.com, so you install a web server. You will also need a static IP address. AWS calls them Elastic IPs. Get one using the AWS management console and assign to your running instance. Done! You can now go back to your DNS service provider / domain registrar and (ask them to) add an A record for your Elastic IP. Then all requests for www.example.com will be sent to your instance.

There are other hosting options available as well. If you want to host a static website, you can take a look at S3 instead of EC2. Maybe you don't even want to host a website - I just assumed that's what you were looking for.

label: Java Development
description:
Re: How to transfer a domain name I own to Amazon (EC2)
Amazon now provide a domain name hosting service, so you can move your domain as well as your site / application / whatever to Amazon.  

"Amazon Route 53

Amazon Route 53 is a highly available and scalable Domain Name System (DNS) web service."

See http://aws.amazon.com/route53/

Hi Bruce,

Recently I saw the EC2 Pricing mentioned

" 
Free Tier

As part of AWS’s Free Usage Tier, new AWS customers can get started with Amazon EC2 for free. Upon sign-up, new AWS customers receive the following EC2 services each month for one year:

750 hours of EC2 running Linux/Unix Micro instance usage
750 hours of Elastic Load Balancing plus 15 GB data processing
10 GB of Amazon Elastic Block Storage (EBS) plus 1 million IOs, 1 GB snapshot storage, 10,000 snapshot Get Requests and 1,000 snapshot Put Requests

AWS: Please, Stay up More Than a Week!
I spent a year selling the merits of AWS to my management.  Last week we launched an epic new service.  Despite being redundant in multiple availability zones, it stopped for two days due to the cross zone RDS issue.   Amazon put in a Spamhouse default block on all instances forcing us to add an elastic IP to all instances that send e-mails for simple password resets.   Today, issues with our elastic IP's across availability zones brought us down, still waiting for a resolution (help!).   In our seven days in production, we've been down three.  Now I am eating crow with management.   

Amazon, can you stay up for more than a week?

label: Java Development
description:
Re: AWS down
Hi,

Here's a couple of links that may help you:

AWS Service Health Dashboard
AWS Report An Issue

Note: the report an issue link can be found in the service health dashboard page (at the top right hand corner of the table listing the various statuses).

I would recommend checking the status of the service related to the issue you are experiencing and then, if there is no problem mentioned, using the report an issue link.

Hope this helps you to get your issue sorted.

Cheers,
Alex

PS, one of the last comments re: the recent EBS Northern Virginia issues was:

" If you believe you are still having issues related to this event and we have not contacted you tonight, please contact us here. In the "Service" field, please select Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud. In the description field, please list the instance and volume IDs and describe the issue you're experiencing.  "

Edited by: Alex Hague on Apr 28, 2011 4:20 AM

label: Java Development
description:
.NET library for Route 53
Hi Everyone,

I'd just like to let any interested parties know, that we've released a .NET library for interfacing with Route 53. It provides an object oriented way to interact with all aspects of the Route 53 API.

For non-commerical purposes, its freely available (and can be licensed for commercial use).

We've also released a companion application as an example of how the library can be used. This is a Windows desktop app, that allows for full management of Route 53 zones. The C# source code to this app is freely available to assist developers in getting start with our library.

The library can be found at R53Connect
The desktop app can be found at R53Desktop

This is our initial release, we'd love to hear feedback, thoughts, comments, suggestions etc.

Cheers,
Alex

Edited by: Alex Hague on Apr 27, 2011 6:45 PM

label: Java Development
description:
Re: AWS Toolkit for Eclipse Don't Work
Hey diegoahgora,

My guess is that something happened when copying the DTP-1.7 plugins/ and features/ folders into your Eclipse install.

Since you're using Eclipse-3.5 Galileo, you don't need to do anything extra to get the right version of DTP.  (That's only necessary for Eclipse-3.4 Ganymede.)

Try re-downloading a fresh install of Eclipse-3.5 Galileo (JEE distribution) from the link you included, and then try installing the AWS Toolkit for Eclipse from http://aws.amazon.com/eclipse .

Hope that helps.  Let us know how it goes!
j

label: Java Development
description:
Re: AWS Toolkit for Eclipse Don't Work
Only the source is available through GitHub, you need the built plugins/features.  You should really use Eclipse's update manager, otherwise it's very easy to get your Eclipse install in a bad situation by installing plugins manually (ex: you won't get proper plugin dependency checking).

Are you able to view this URL:
http://aws.amazon.com/eclipse/site.xml 

Eclipse pulls that first, then pulls the individual plugin/feature zip files from Amazon CloudFront.

Try opening Eclipse's "Error Log" view and see if there are any stack traces or extra information available there.

j

label: Java Development
description:
Eclipse AWS Plugin & Tomcat Max Memory
All,First off, I'm new to AWS.I am playing around with EC2 and Tomcat WebApps, is there any way to increase the max heap size?  Generally you could do that via the launch configuration for your servet [Tomcat].  But for EC2 Tomcat, the launch configuration doesn't have that capability.So, is there any way to increase the heapsize (-Xmx) for the JVM that will run tomcat?Cheers.

label: Java Development
description:
Re: Eclipse AWS Plugin & Tomcat Max Memory
In the launch config, it does sayfor additional configuration, open the server's editor under "server" view.More Info:I am using eclipse 3.5Under MacOSX.If I click on the EC2 cluster, I can do "show in > debug or console".  Nothing happens when I do that.If I click open, then it goes to the server overview page...

label: Java Development
description:
Re: Eclipse AWS Plugin & Tomcat Max Memory
Hey ericg22, 

you can't currently configure JVM level settings through the EC2 Tomcat WTP server.  It's a great feature request though.

label: Java Development
description:
Re: Eclipse AWS Plugin & Tomcat Max Memory
Hello,

I know this thread is a bit old, but I would like to revive it because I too am in a situation where I absolutely need to increase the max heap size of my Tomcat WebApp.

I understand that the Eclipse plugin does not allow for this configuration. Here are two possible alternative approaches:

1) Forget about the Eclipse plugin and do everything manually.
2) Create a modified AIM in which the max heap size is set via some environment variables.

Neither option is great, and I'm not sure whether 2) is even possible. So, to my question: does anybody have any suggestions as to how to best go about this?

Any pointers would be greatly appreciated; it is very frustrating that such a simple configuration is so cumbersome.

Thanks,
Michael.

label: Java Development
description:
Re: Eclipse AWS Plugin & Tomcat Max Memory
Hey Michael,

just wanted to make sure you saw that we released AWS Elastic Beanstalk (http://aws.amazon.com/elasticbeanstalk) last week, along with a big update to the Eclipse tools.

This is a big step up in performance and reliability for deploying Java web applications using the AWS Toolkit for Eclipse, and you'll have access to tweak much more configuration, such as JVM settings.

There's a quick screencast showing the new Eclipse functionality here:
http://d1un85p0f2qstc.cloudfront.net/eclipse/elasticbeanstalk/index.html

and also a getting started guide for Eclipse here:
http://aws.amazon.com/articles/4412341514662386

Hope that helps! Try out the new tooling and let us know what you think,
j

label: Java Development
description:
Eclipse Tutorial - Unable to run project
Hi,I am new to the elastic cloud and am trying it out with a view to using it in forthcoming projects.  I started off going though the "Getting Started with Amazon EC2 Management in Eclipse" article (from the AWE Toolkit for Eclipse page).I created the application and it successfully runs from eclipse using a local Tomcat instance - no issues.  I then created the server exactly as in the tutorial (5 instances, no elastic ip, same security group (all zeros in each entry), ami-11ca2d78 etc).  The instances all start up and I am able to successfully secure shell into them.When I run the application on this Amazon cluster, I get a message in the Eclipse browser- "503 Service Unavailable - No server is available to handle this request".  I have tried several times yesterdayand today and still get this message.I also tried defining a single server (same AMI) in case it was the cluster going wrong.  When I do this I get a message "Navigation to the webpage was cancelled" - on refreshing the page as the browser suggests, I get a "This program cannot display the webpage".I spent much of yesterday and today playing with this and have been through some other tutorials, each of which defines a single serverand each time I get this set of messages.  There is no difference if I add an elastic IP either.  I have tried on US West and East coast with the same result.I am not sure if there is a step missing somewhere, but I am running the app fine locally and following the steps exactly.  My bill is rising and I have not had a single application.Can someone help me get this working please ?Thanks in advance !

label: Java Development
description:
Re: Eclipse Tutorial - Unable to run project
Hey srisom,

I'm not sure exactly what's happening, but maybe some of these ideas will help turn up a clue...

if you're having problems, simplifying is definitely a good idea.  It sounds like you've already tried with just a single EC2 Tomcat instance without an Elastic IP.  I'd stick with that to start off while you get everything figured out.

Make sure that you're right clicking on the servlet you want to run (whether in the editor or from the package explorer view) and selecting "run as..." -> "run on servier" then your EC2 Tomcat server.  Clicking directly on the project and selecting "run as..." -> "run on server" probably won't work because there isn't a default resource defined.

There might also be something in your network configuration causing problems.  If you have to go through a proxy server to get to the internet, you might have some problems using the Eclipse tools since they need to ssh to the EC2 hosts and configure everything.

Another problem I've run into is that port 8080 is blocked by some firewalls, so I have to change my Tomcat configuration to launch on port 80 instead (default is 8080 of course), and make sure that port is also open to CIDR IP 0.0.0.0/0 in your security group like you mentioned.

If you can ssh into the EC2 box, then you might try using curl or wget to hit "localhost:80" and see if you can access the server from there.  If so, then it seems likely to be a security group or network firewall/proxy issue.

Finally, don't forget to check the "Error Log" view in Eclipse to see if there are any clues in there.

hope that helps,
j

label: Java Development
description:
Re: Eclipse Tutorial - Unable to run project
Jason,Thank you so much for answering and giving some pointers.  I have been through the points and discovered that:1) Right clicking is ok.  I am doing that on the servlet - if I do this and choose my local Tomcat then it all works fine.2) Don't think I am going through a proxy - certainly the browsers have no entries and I have never had to put one in for anything - so this is unlikely.3) I logged on with ssh and from the server tried both curl and wget on localhost ports 80 and 8080.  Both tools failed ('couln't connect to host' from curl and 'Connection refused' from wget).4) I went into the Tomcat/conf directory on the server and swapped both references to 8080 in server.xml to 80, set JAVA_HOME to /env/jdk, ran the shutdown in the tomcat bin directory (this gave a connection refused error) and ran startup without error.  I hope this is correct to change the port.  After doing this I got the same messages from wget and curl.  I tried restarting the Tomcat server from the server view in Eclipse but it terminated the entire server and started a new one (so I lost my port 80 changes).My security group has all zeros set for ports 22,80,443 and 8080.  My local error log is completely empty.I am guessing that the issue is something to do with the connection failures etc on the server but am in the dark as to next steps.Can you offer any advice / suggestions ?Much appreciated !

label: Java Development
description:
Re: Eclipse Tutorial - Unable to run project
I too am having the same issue and have also tried the pointers that have been discused. Ibstill get the 503 Error and am patiently waiting for a responce to this thread so that i may continue with my venture.

label: Java Development
description:
Re: Eclipse Tutorial - Unable to run project
well i wasn't able to figure anything out on the 503 error however when i started a new server cluster i no longer get that error Now i have a new problem though so istarted a new thread to resolve the new issue

label: Java Development
description:
Re: Eclipse Tutorial - Unable to run project
I have got a bit further on this.  I discovered by logging into the AMI and checking the processes, that Tomcat is not started.  Trying to start it (setting environment and doing a catalina start) causes a java stack trace.At this point I gave up on this AMI.  I have successfully deployed my app using the Java Web Apps in a Box AMI.  You cannot deploy directly from eclipse but you can export to a WAR file and load into tomcat with no issues.  I am going down that road unless the standard AMI gets sorted.Google 'Java development 2.0:Easy EC2' and follow the IBM step through.

label: Java Development
description:
Re: Eclipse Tutorial - Unable to run project
Hey srisom,I just checked out the IBM DeveloperWorks article you mentioned.  it looks like a great walkthrough for Eclipse/EC2/Java/Tomcat.  I'm glad you were able to get that setup working.I'm not sure why Tomcat wouldn't be starting up for you.  I'll see if we can reproduce that over here.  If you or others on the thread see this again, you can launch Eclipse from a command line with the "-debug -consoleLog" options, you should get debugging output in your terminal window from the toolkit that provides some clues as to what's happening when something goes wrong when Eclipse is launching the EC2 instances, pushing the application and starting Tomcat.  The output is fairly verbose, so feel free to private message it to me and I'd be happy to take a look and see if we can find any clues.

label: Java Development
description:
Re: Eclipse Tutorial - Unable to run project
A Solution!! (I think)

I had the exact same problem, everything working fine locally but could get nothing to run on AmazonEC2. I too noticed from the shell log for catalina.out that tomcat wasn't started.

A day and a half later...

I found the problem to be my server runtime environment in eclipse when you set up the server. It was set as Apache Tomcat V 6.0, of course, but I was using the latest version (6.0.24) and this seems to be the problem. I downloaded an older version from the Tomcat archive (6.0.18) and added this when configuring runtime environments. Setting up an instance with this server runtime environment works!

I hope this helps anyone who stumbles along here.
But why does 6.0.24 not work!!?? Can this be fixed?

label: Java Development
description:
Re: Eclipse Tutorial - Unable to run project
Hey Lemis,

We just released AWS Elastic Beanstalk last week (http://aws.amazon.com/elasticbeanstalk), which provides a really easy and highly configurable way to run Java web apps on AWS and have them automatically scale with load.

As part of that release, we did a big upgrade to the AWS Toolkit for Eclipse to support AWS Elastic Beanstalk.  We're still using all the same WTP tools in Eclipse, so your workflow shouldn't change much, but there is a new server type you can use: "AWS Elastic Beanstalk for Tomcat 6".

I'd definitely encourage you to try the new system; you should see much faster and more reliable performance now that AWS Elastic Beanstalk does all the heavy lifting.

There's a quick screencast showing the new Eclipse functionality here:
http://d1un85p0f2qstc.cloudfront.net/eclipse/elasticbeanstalk/index.html

and also a getting started guide for Eclipse here:
http://aws.amazon.com/articles/4412341514662386

Hope that helps!  Please try out the new tooling and let us know what you think.  It should be a big step up over the previous tooling in Eclipse,
j

Hi Chris,

The S3 Console uses flash to talk to the S3 servers. This has been the case since the S3 console was first released. Given that the iPad doesn't have flash support, the S3 Console would have never been accessible from the iPad. 

As regards the folks having trouble loading the console, would you please provide the ID of the diagnostic report generated by the console test page, and we will investigate.

For those in corporate environments, we are working on a way for you to access the console without making any firewall changes. We will update this thread when new information pertinent to your access issues is available. 

Thanks,
Manoj

description:
Re: Problems logging into AWS Management Console
Hi, danedanedane,

I'm sorry for the trouble you're having accessing this service.

Approval for your Amazon EC2 account is still pending. This usually happens when we're unable to verify your credit card details. Please update your payment information by following these steps:

1. Go to http://aws.amazon.com
2. Click on Account > Payment Method.
3. If prompted, sign in with your AWS account e-mail address and password.
4. Click "Edit this card" to update the expiration date or billing address for your current payment method, or select or enter a different payment method.

You'll receive a confirmation e-mail when your account is approved.

I hope this helps. We look forward to seeing you again soon.

Best regards,
Matthew P.

Feedback on the Manamement Console
Hello,

I would like give you some Feedback on the AWS Management Console.

Bugs:

Instances: After launching a new instance the final "close" button in the dialog does not work. Only the closing button in the upper right corner works. After that, sometimes the "launch instance" button does not work any more.
Security Groups: It is not possible to add a new custom rule with protocol, port and group. Only predefined ones or custom but without group or custom with group but without specific protocol and port. The html form fields are always cleared by JavaScript.
Security Groups: When you add rule to group A, the switch to group B and then back to A it says "No records found."
Sometimes the navigation "AWS | Products | Developers ..." in the upper right corner shifts down to the tab "Amazon S3 | Amazon EC2 ...".
Account, Personal Information: The form does not work with special characters, e.g. München (Munich).


My browser is Chrome 7.

Apart from this it would be great to add multiple security groups to one instance.

First EC2 page after login: Not everyone is an American and using the default region. So why is it displayed always the first time? Even for people just using e.g. eu-west-1. It would be much better to see the actually used EC2 region first.

Best regards,
Bernd

Edited by: iblu on Nov 28, 2010 12:48 AM

label: Java Development
description:
Re: Feedback on the Manamement Console
Thanks for taking the time to give us feedback!  We will take a look and see what we can improve.

A couple things:

You can select any number of Security Groups in the Launch Instances Wizard (use cmd-click or alt-click on Security Groups).  

For custom Security Group rules, the Console only supports Group rules or protocol/port/cidr rules.
That is, if you specify another group in your rule, you are allowing instances in the target group full access to the instances in the allowing group.
Security Groups are a confusing topic, we hope to improve the UI for them in the future.

And finally, yes, the navigation (and other things) may compress in funny ways if the browser width is too narrow.

-Dave

Can't connect to SQL Server 2014 Express AMI

When I use the RDP session I only see one Command Prompt window.  I don't see a Windows UI.  Is this AMI bad?

label: Java Development
description:
Re: Can't connect to SQL Server 2014 Express AMI
The AMI contains Windows Server Core Install : https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/hh846323(v=vs.85).aspx, so seeing only Command Prompt is expected.

By default the network services are disabled on SQL Server. Need to restart network services to be able to reach SQL Server (port 1443) from outside server.

Following is the way to enable the networking service:
1. Use netstat -a -b to verify port 1433 is not LISTENING
2. Run C:\Windows\SysWOW64\SQLServerManager12.msc from cmd.exe to open SQL Server 2014 Configuration Manager
3. Follow Steps in Microsoft Article   https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/sql/database-engine/configure-windows/enable-or-disable-a-server-network-protocol?view=sql-server-2017  to check the network status, enable, and restart SQL Server
4. After SQL Server restart, check for port status using netstat -a -b
5. Should be able to connect from other servers after that, off course assuming the port is allowed.

Hope this helps.

Re: Is CustomerIdentifier always unique per user?
CustomerIdentifier is associated with a single AWS account. If multiple users share the same AWS account (through IAM roles, for example), yes, they will share the same CustomerIdentifier.

label: Java Development
Java Development
description:
Re: China resources
Hi,

We'd be happy to help as these are common challenges - downloading from foreign mirrors (wait until you try NPM) is a challenge - on your other issues:

1. `apt-get install maven` took about 2-3 hours to download all dependencies;

Yes - careful mirror selection is critical here; there are some choices.

2. `mvn build` hangs on downloading Maven/Java dependencies;

Best to mirror  - we also do local caching on Jenkins some times for this.

3. an `ssh` connection to EC2 in CN too slow - can't even type commands (I'm writing them in a text editor, and then copy-paste to the terminal).

This is usually a routing issue - try going indirectly to Korea or Japan or if in Europe, Singapore first then to Bejing - can make a huge difference.

We help lots of companies with these challenges as the only China-based AWS MSP, so feel free to contact me.

Steve Mushero, CEO
ChinaNetCloud - Only China-Based AWS MSP
www.ChinaNetCloud.com

label: Java Development
description:
AWS Status page improvement (JSON and CORS support)
I m using several cloud provider to operate my application and need to retrieve information from all my providers. To do that I use their “status page” like :
http://status.aws.amazon.com/
https://status.cloud.google.com/
…

I retrieve from them the list of incidents as a JSON stream. Here is the Example for google :
https://status.cloud.google.com/incidents.json

When I tried to do the same for AWS I run into several issue. First the JSON URL is hard to find so I think it should be added on the status page (see how google do it). 
After I find the JSON URL : http://status.aws.amazon.com/data.json I had error to retrieve data from it because of CORS.

It would be much easier if this page which is public and aim to distribute information allow CORS from all domain (like Google do with the CORS allow all header).

I hope AWS will take that into consideration to improve the experience for developers.

Cheers, Charles

label: Java Development
description:
Re: AWS Status page improvement (JSON and CORS support)
Here is the answer from the AWS engineer contacted through my company :

The JSON version of the AWS Status data that you found is actually an undocumented, internal API that the web page uses.
The official and supported programmatic way of getting AWS status information is to use the various RSS feeds that you see on the page to the right of the table entries.
As you can see, the RSS feed URLs follow a simple naming convention, so you don't need to copy paste them into a large table, instead, you can use any of the popular RSS feed parsers and a few for loops to cycle through all the regions and services that interest you and retrieve their status information.

I hope it can help some people.

description:
key pair in eclipse toolkit
Hi,I've setup the eclipse toolkit and it is listing my instance but the key pair has a big red 'x' next to its name.  I can also not connect to the instance via the eclipse toolkit. Everything works well in the aws console or elasticfox.  I have the keys in ~/.ec2/ in which they should be detected automatically. What am I missing?  How can I fix this?- Markus

label: Java Development
description:
Re: key pair in eclipse toolkit
Hey Markus,

that red 'x' definitely means the toolkit can't find your private key, just like you mentioned.  

There's two ways to take care of this:
 1 - ensure that the corresponding private keys live in ~/.ec2/ and that the file name is in the form "<key-name>.pem" .   It sounds like you've already got your keys in the right directory, so I'm guessing maybe they just have a different file extension?  Some private keys on windows/mac tend to use different extensions depending on which platform they're created for, so maybe the toolkit needs to be aware of that and accept other extensions, too.  If that's what's happening to you, i'll open a bug report so we can add that feature.

 2 - If you can get to EC2 Key Pair widget (in the Launch Wizard for example), you can right click on the key pair and click the "Select private key file" menu item to explicitly map a private key to a key pair.  I've got a change open to make it easier to get to that Key Pair widget from the preferences, but until that's submitted and built, you can find it on the Launch Wizard.

Let us know if that helps and if you have any other feedback,
j

label: Java Development
description:
Re: key pair in eclipse toolkit

description:
API restrictions
Hi there, I'm quite new here and I'm planning to use the SDK API to create my own console administration for my Amazon servers. 
I would like to control (launch, stop, etc) and monitor them (performance, errors, etc).  I know this is a too general question but is there any restriction in the API regarding to what I could do through the official console?

Thank you.

label: Java Development
description:
Re: API restrictions
Yes, it is a very broad question, but I would say that you can expect to find nearly everything around server management in the "raw" APIs. I believe the SDKs are relatively complete in general as well, with one exception: The AWS SDK for JavaScript in the Browser supports only a small number of services (that have CORS support).

Hello,

Account and service activation usually takes just a few minutes, but can take up to 24 hours in some cases. For security reasons we do not provide account specific details in the public forums. http://aws.amazon.com/contact-us/

label: Java Development
description:
Re: rds-download-db-logfile
Hey,

403 is an authentication error.

I had the same problem, and what worked for me is setting the region variable in my .bashrc file, in my case eu-west-1b:
export EC2_REGION=eu-west-1b


Also, don't forget to create your credentials file.

For more information you can see AWS's guide:
http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonRDS/latest/CommandLineReference/StartCLI.html

description:
Re: Help with Creating API URL Signature
fixed. Exact format is something looks like this
GET
ec2.amazonaws.com
/ 
AWSAccessKeyId=AKIAJH43UFXANDWWWL6A&Action=DescribeInstances&SignatureMethod=HmacSHA256&SignatureVersion=2&Timestamp=2013-02-05T03%3A44%3A38&Version=2012-04-01


Timestamp encoding was the problem. ":" need convert into "%3A" but "-" remains as "-". So it is not full url encode, only encode some charters.

label: Java Development
description:
AWS Toolkit for Eclipse: proxy problem
My computer is behind a NTLMv2 proxy so I succeeded in installing AWS Toolkit only after I disabled the ECF httpclient provider.Now, my attempts to test my connection to Simpledb service fail so I guess the problem is due to the presence of this proxy, but I have no Idea how I can workaround it: can you help me?Thanks

label: Java Development
description:
Re: AWS Toolkit for Eclipse: proxy problem
this sounds like a tricky one...  I had to search around for info on NTLM, and after searching I found the docs you must have found describing how to disable Apache HttpClient (which doesn't support NTLM), so that Eclipse uses URLConnection (which does support NTLM) when you use the Eclipse Update Manager:
http://wiki.eclipse.org/ECF_Filetransfer_Support_for_NTLMv2_Proxies

Once you get the plugin installed, it uses the AWS client libraries to community with Amazon SimpleDB, which relies on Apache HttpClient, which doesn't support NTLM.

There's not an easy way to change the AWS SimpleDB library to use an HTTP client that supports NTLM, but...

you could try using a free NTLM proxy like Cntlm:
http://cntlm.sourceforge.net/

with that, you should be able to start up the Cntlm proxy on your computer, and tell eclipse to use it as a proxy instead of directly hitting the NTLM proxy.  Cntlm acts as a SOCKS5 proxy, which Apache HttpClient does support.

This makes me think this is an important setting to have. Instead of the error being that I cannot find the host the error is now...SEVERE: Unable to execute HTTP request: The host did not accept the connection within timeout of 50000 msException in thread "main" com.amazonaws.AmazonClientException: Unable to execute HTTP request: The host did not accept the connection within timeout of 50000 ms    at com.amazonaws.http.HttpClient.execute(HttpClient.java:185)    at com.amazonaws.services.ec2.AmazonEC2Client.invoke(AmazonEC2Client.java:2914)    at com.amazonaws.services.ec2.AmazonEC2Client.describeAvailabilityZones(AmazonEC2Client.java:309)    at com.amazonaws.services.ec2.AmazonEC2Client.describeAvailabilityZones(AmazonEC2Client.java:2466)    at AwsConsoleApp.main(AwsConsoleApp.java:124)Caused by: org.apache.commons.httpclient.ConnectTimeoutException: The host did not accept the connection within timeout of 50000 ms    at org.apache.commons.httpclient.protocol.ControllerThreadSocketFactory.createSocket(ControllerThreadSocketFactory.java:96)    at org.apache.commons.httpclient.protocol.SSLProtocolSocketFactory.createSocket(SSLProtocolSocketFactory.java:132)    at org.apache.commons.httpclient.HttpConnection.open(HttpConnection.java:706)    at org.apache.commons.httpclient.MultiThreadedHttpConnectionManager$HttpConnectionAdapter.open(MultiThreadedHttpConnectionManager.java:1321)    at org.apache.commons.httpclient.HttpMethodDirector.executeWithRetry(HttpMethodDirector.java:386)    at org.apache.commons.httpclient.HttpMethodDirector.executeMethod(HttpMethodDirector.java:170)    at org.apache.commons.httpclient.HttpClient.executeMethod(HttpClient.java:396)    at org.apache.commons.httpclient.HttpClient.executeMethod(HttpClient.java:324)    at com.amazonaws.http.HttpClient.execute(HttpClient.java:127)    ... 4 more

label: Java Development
description:
Re: AWS Toolkit for Eclipse: proxy problem
Hey Mark,

the very first thing I'd do is figure out exactly what your proxy settings are (i.e. SOCKS5 vs. HTTP, host, port, is a username/pass required, etc.)

For a SOCKS5 proxy, it looks like you already know what you're doing, but others reading this thread might find this link interesting: http://java.sun.com/javase/6/docs/technotes/guides/net/proxies.html

Next, check out the ClientConfiguration class in the AWS SDK for Java:
http://docs.amazonwebservices.com/AWSJavaSDK/latest/javadoc/com/amazonaws/ClientConfiguration.html

There are some additional proxy settings there, although from what I remember, for SOCKS proxies, setting the system properties should work.

Also in ClientConfiguration, you can set the default protocol (HTTP or HTTPS) clients will use to connect to AWS:
http://docs.amazonwebservices.com/AWSJavaSDK/latest/javadoc/com/amazonaws/ClientConfiguration.html#setProtocol(com.amazonaws.Protocol)

You could try changing that to Protocol.HTTP (the default is HTTPS) and see if that works better with your network configuration.

To use a custom ClientConfiguration object, just pass it in to the AmazonS3Client constructor when you create your client object.

hope that helps.  let us know how it goes,
j

label: Java Development
description:
reserved instance
Hello,

We decided to buy reserved instance m1.large windows server for three years term (Heavy Utilization Reserved Instance). And in your table it shows 1700$ / 3year.
I want to know 
is there  any other charges in addition to this $1700?
because table shows 0.16$/hour for windoews usage . what is this?

Regards
saravana

label: Java Development
description:
Re: reserved instance
Hi pixelsaravana,

That is your hourly rate.  Since you purchased a Heavy Utilization RI, you will pay this hourly rate regardless of whether you launch an instance with the covered RI parameters or not.

So for example in March there are 31 X 24 = 744 hours.  If the term of the RI covers the entire month of March, you would pay 744 X $0.16/hour or $119.04 in hourly charges.  

A One-Time up front non-refundable RI charge gives you the option to later run instances at lower hourly rates than list prices.  For Heavy RIs, you pay the hourly rates whether you run the an instance on the covered parameters or not.

Bronson

label: Java Development
description:
temporarily stopping an instance query
Hi folks,

I am a newbie to AWS and have been reading up on the tutorials etc. and wonder if someone could clarify the following points:

1. if I uploaded an application to the server, would it still be there if I temporarily stopped the service at close of business, only to open it the following day?

2. would I get charged for the downtime?

Thanks for your help.

Regards

G

label: Java Development
description:
Re: temporarily stopping an instance query
When you stop an EC2 instance, you will only be charged for the allocated storage. There are no other charges until you start the instance again. When the instance starts, your data is still there. Stopping an instance is like turning off your computer. However, the instance will get a new IP address upon boot.

label: Java Development
description:
Re: Firefox Extension for Amazon EC2 and Firefox 3.0
The "connect by SSH" button is magical. I had used the command line tools on a unix box to set up AWS, but Iwanted PuTTY to work through ElasticFox on my Windows machine. It wastrivially simple, once I figured out how to do it. It sure would benice to have this built into the documentation.1. Get the id_rsa-gsg-keypair that you generated from your .pems onto your Windows machine.2. Find and open PuTTYgen.exe - mine was not in the PATH but in C:\Program Files\PuTTY3. On the PuTTYgen "panel" in the "Actions" section press the bigbutton that says "Load" to load an existing private key file. Point itto your id_rsa-gsg-keypair.4. In the same part of the PuTTYgen interface, click on the big buttonthat says "Save in Private key" to save the generated key. 5. In the resulting dialog box, navigate to your home directory inC:\Documents and Settings[username] (not "My Documents" but thedirectory above it.). Make a directory called "ec2-keys" and finallysave the file as "gsg-keypair.ppk"6. You should now be able to connect to a listed instance with PuTTYssh by just pushing the magic button. Of course, this connects you as ROOT from within your WEB BROWSER so use your new terminal to change your root certificate and set up a user account with admin permissions. YOU HAVE BEEN WARNED!

label: Java Development
description:
How to transfer a domain name I own to Amazon (EC2)
Hi,

Can anyone tell me how I might go about transferring a domain from one host to my amazon account? I have launched an instance and can log into remote desktop. I want to upload my web application but am unsure how I am to link it to my domain which I need to transfer to AWS.

Help anyone? Thanks

label: Java Development
description:
Re: How to transfer a domain name I own to Amazon (EC2)
You don't transfer your domain name to AWS.  Rather allocate an Elastic IP address and the associate it to your instance.  Then go to your domain provider and point your domain to the Elastic IP address.  You don't need to transfer your domain to AWS.  You can do this from the AWS management console.In this way, you can start a second instance and test any application updates, then just move the Elastic IP to the second instance without having to make any changes with your domain provider.

label: Java Development
description:
Re: How to transfer a domain name I own to Amazon (EC2)
Hi,
i am living in Italy, i would transfer my domain to Amazon(Ec2), how can i do?
i must use elastic ip?
is there different way to resorve this problem?

label: Java Development
description:
Re: How to transfer a domain name I own to Amazon (EC2)
As BrianW@AWS said, you don't transfer the domain name to AWS. They are not a domain registrar. What you want to do is modify the DNS records. If you haven't purchased a DNS service from a third party, then this is probably provided by your current domain registrar. You need to locate any web control panel they might have provided you with or ask them how to update DNS records.

Let's say you want to host your domain www.example.com at AWS. First you launch an EC2 instance, and configure it according to your requirements. In this example you might want to serve web pages for www.example.com, so you install a web server. You will also need a static IP address. AWS calls them Elastic IPs. Get one using the AWS management console and assign to your running instance. Done! You can now go back to your DNS service provider / domain registrar and (ask them to) add an A record for your Elastic IP. Then all requests for www.example.com will be sent to your instance.

There are other hosting options available as well. If you want to host a static website, you can take a look at S3 instead of EC2. Maybe you don't even want to host a website - I just assumed that's what you were looking for.

label: Java Development
description:
Re: How to transfer a domain name I own to Amazon (EC2)
Amazon now provide a domain name hosting service, so you can move your domain as well as your site / application / whatever to Amazon.  

"Amazon Route 53

Amazon Route 53 is a highly available and scalable Domain Name System (DNS) web service."

See http://aws.amazon.com/route53/

label: Java Development
description:
Re: AWS down
Hi,

Here's a couple of links that may help you:

AWS Service Health Dashboard
AWS Report An Issue

Note: the report an issue link can be found in the service health dashboard page (at the top right hand corner of the table listing the various statuses).

I would recommend checking the status of the service related to the issue you are experiencing and then, if there is no problem mentioned, using the report an issue link.

Hope this helps you to get your issue sorted.

Cheers,
Alex

PS, one of the last comments re: the recent EBS Northern Virginia issues was:

" If you believe you are still having issues related to this event and we have not contacted you tonight, please contact us here. In the "Service" field, please select Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud. In the description field, please list the instance and volume IDs and describe the issue you're experiencing.  "

label: Java Development
description:
.NET library for Route 53
Hi Everyone,

I'd just like to let any interested parties know, that we've released a .NET library for interfacing with Route 53. It provides an object oriented way to interact with all aspects of the Route 53 API.

For non-commerical purposes, its freely available (and can be licensed for commercial use).

We've also released a companion application as an example of how the library can be used. This is a Windows desktop app, that allows for full management of Route 53 zones. The C# source code to this app is freely available to assist developers in getting start with our library.

The library can be found at R53Connect
The desktop app can be found at R53Desktop

This is our initial release, we'd love to hear feedback, thoughts, comments, suggestions etc.

Cheers,
Alex

Edited by: Alex Hague on Apr 27, 2011 6:45 PM

First you need to cancel all services. Then you can ask AWS to close your account. Links for both are here: http://aws.amazon.com/contact-us/

label: Java Development
description:
Re: Strange - Amazon EC2 is spam virus exploit?
If you used a community AMI, you open yourself up to the whims of the creator of the AMI. Just like you do by exercising your free choice in downloading some program on the internet. 

Community AMIs from reputable sources are a great asset, but you're on your own for deciding what to use.

label: Java Development
description:
Re: AWS Toolkit for Eclipse Don't Work
Hey diegoahgora,

My guess is that something happened when copying the DTP-1.7 plugins/ and features/ folders into your Eclipse install.

Since you're using Eclipse-3.5 Galileo, you don't need to do anything extra to get the right version of DTP.  (That's only necessary for Eclipse-3.4 Ganymede.)

Try re-downloading a fresh install of Eclipse-3.5 Galileo (JEE distribution) from the link you included, and then try installing the AWS Toolkit for Eclipse from http://aws.amazon.com/eclipse .

Hope that helps.  Let us know how it goes!
j

label: Java Development
description:
Re: AWS Toolkit for Eclipse Don't Work
Only the source is available through GitHub, you need the built plugins/features.  You should really use Eclipse's update manager, otherwise it's very easy to get your Eclipse install in a bad situation by installing plugins manually (ex: you won't get proper plugin dependency checking).

Are you able to view this URL:
http://aws.amazon.com/eclipse/site.xml 

Eclipse pulls that first, then pulls the individual plugin/feature zip files from Amazon CloudFront.

Try opening Eclipse's "Error Log" view and see if there are any stack traces or extra information available there.

j

description:
Eclipse AWS Plugin & Tomcat Max Memory
All,First off, I'm new to AWS.I am playing around with EC2 and Tomcat WebApps, is there any way to increase the max heap size?  Generally you could do that via the launch configuration for your servet [Tomcat].  But for EC2 Tomcat, the launch configuration doesn't have that capability.So, is there any way to increase the heapsize (-Xmx) for the JVM that will run tomcat?Cheers.

label: Java Development
description:
Re: Eclipse AWS Plugin & Tomcat Max Memory
Hey ericg22, 

you can't currently configure JVM level settings through the EC2 Tomcat WTP server.  It's a great feature request though.

label: Java Development
description:
Re: Eclipse AWS Plugin & Tomcat Max Memory
Hello,

I know this thread is a bit old, but I would like to revive it because I too am in a situation where I absolutely need to increase the max heap size of my Tomcat WebApp.

I understand that the Eclipse plugin does not allow for this configuration. Here are two possible alternative approaches:

1) Forget about the Eclipse plugin and do everything manually.
2) Create a modified AIM in which the max heap size is set via some environment variables.

Neither option is great, and I'm not sure whether 2) is even possible. So, to my question: does anybody have any suggestions as to how to best go about this?

Any pointers would be greatly appreciated; it is very frustrating that such a simple configuration is so cumbersome.

Thanks,
Michael.

label: Java Development
description:
Re: Eclipse AWS Plugin & Tomcat Max Memory
Hey Michael,

just wanted to make sure you saw that we released AWS Elastic Beanstalk (http://aws.amazon.com/elasticbeanstalk) last week, along with a big update to the Eclipse tools.

This is a big step up in performance and reliability for deploying Java web applications using the AWS Toolkit for Eclipse, and you'll have access to tweak much more configuration, such as JVM settings.

There's a quick screencast showing the new Eclipse functionality here:
http://d1un85p0f2qstc.cloudfront.net/eclipse/elasticbeanstalk/index.html

and also a getting started guide for Eclipse here:
http://aws.amazon.com/articles/4412341514662386

Hope that helps! Try out the new tooling and let us know what you think,
j

label: Java Development
description:
Eclipse Tutorial - Unable to run project
Hi,I am new to the elastic cloud and am trying it out with a view to using it in forthcoming projects.  I started off going though the "Getting Started with Amazon EC2 Management in Eclipse" article (from the AWE Toolkit for Eclipse page).I created the application and it successfully runs from eclipse using a local Tomcat instance - no issues.  I then created the server exactly as in the tutorial (5 instances, no elastic ip, same security group (all zeros in each entry), ami-11ca2d78 etc).  The instances all start up and I am able to successfully secure shell into them.When I run the application on this Amazon cluster, I get a message in the Eclipse browser- "503 Service Unavailable - No server is available to handle this request".  I have tried several times yesterdayand today and still get this message.I also tried defining a single server (same AMI) in case it was the cluster going wrong.  When I do this I get a message "Navigation to the webpage was cancelled" - on refreshing the page as the browser suggests, I get a "This program cannot display the webpage".I spent much of yesterday and today playing with this and have been through some other tutorials, each of which defines a single serverand each time I get this set of messages.  There is no difference if I add an elastic IP either.  I have tried on US West and East coast with the same result.I am not sure if there is a step missing somewhere, but I am running the app fine locally and following the steps exactly.  My bill is rising and I have not had a single application.Can someone help me get this working please ?Thanks in advance !

label: Java Development
description:
Re: Eclipse Tutorial - Unable to run project
Hey srisom,

I'm not sure exactly what's happening, but maybe some of these ideas will help turn up a clue...

if you're having problems, simplifying is definitely a good idea.  It sounds like you've already tried with just a single EC2 Tomcat instance without an Elastic IP.  I'd stick with that to start off while you get everything figured out.

Make sure that you're right clicking on the servlet you want to run (whether in the editor or from the package explorer view) and selecting "run as..." -> "run on servier" then your EC2 Tomcat server.  Clicking directly on the project and selecting "run as..." -> "run on server" probably won't work because there isn't a default resource defined.

There might also be something in your network configuration causing problems.  If you have to go through a proxy server to get to the internet, you might have some problems using the Eclipse tools since they need to ssh to the EC2 hosts and configure everything.

Another problem I've run into is that port 8080 is blocked by some firewalls, so I have to change my Tomcat configuration to launch on port 80 instead (default is 8080 of course), and make sure that port is also open to CIDR IP 0.0.0.0/0 in your security group like you mentioned.

If you can ssh into the EC2 box, then you might try using curl or wget to hit "localhost:80" and see if you can access the server from there.  If so, then it seems likely to be a security group or network firewall/proxy issue.

Finally, don't forget to check the "Error Log" view in Eclipse to see if there are any clues in there.

hope that helps,
j

label: Java Development
description:
Re: Eclipse Tutorial - Unable to run project
Jason,Thank you so much for answering and giving some pointers.  I have been through the points and discovered that:1) Right clicking is ok.  I am doing that on the servlet - if I do this and choose my local Tomcat then it all works fine.2) Don't think I am going through a proxy - certainly the browsers have no entries and I have never had to put one in for anything - so this is unlikely.3) I logged on with ssh and from the server tried both curl and wget on localhost ports 80 and 8080.  Both tools failed ('couln't connect to host' from curl and 'Connection refused' from wget).4) I went into the Tomcat/conf directory on the server and swapped both references to 8080 in server.xml to 80, set JAVA_HOME to /env/jdk, ran the shutdown in the tomcat bin directory (this gave a connection refused error) and ran startup without error.  I hope this is correct to change the port.  After doing this I got the same messages from wget and curl.  I tried restarting the Tomcat server from the server view in Eclipse but it terminated the entire server and started a new one (so I lost my port 80 changes).My security group has all zeros set for ports 22,80,443 and 8080.  My local error log is completely empty.I am guessing that the issue is something to do with the connection failures etc on the server but am in the dark as to next steps.Can you offer any advice / suggestions ?Much appreciated !

description:
Re: Eclipse Tutorial - Unable to run project
I have got a bit further on this.  I discovered by logging into the AMI and checking the processes, that Tomcat is not started.  Trying to start it (setting environment and doing a catalina start) causes a java stack trace.At this point I gave up on this AMI.  I have successfully deployed my app using the Java Web Apps in a Box AMI.  You cannot deploy directly from eclipse but you can export to a WAR file and load into tomcat with no issues.  I am going down that road unless the standard AMI gets sorted.Google 'Java development 2.0:Easy EC2' and follow the IBM step through.

label: Java Development
description:
Re: Eclipse Tutorial - Unable to run project
Hey srisom,I just checked out the IBM DeveloperWorks article you mentioned.  it looks like a great walkthrough for Eclipse/EC2/Java/Tomcat.  I'm glad you were able to get that setup working.I'm not sure why Tomcat wouldn't be starting up for you.  I'll see if we can reproduce that over here.  If you or others on the thread see this again, you can launch Eclipse from a command line with the "-debug -consoleLog" options, you should get debugging output in your terminal window from the toolkit that provides some clues as to what's happening when something goes wrong when Eclipse is launching the EC2 instances, pushing the application and starting Tomcat.  The output is fairly verbose, so feel free to private message it to me and I'd be happy to take a look and see if we can find any clues.

description:
Re: Eclipse Tutorial - Unable to run project
Hey srisom,

very interesting that everything works from the browser, but not from Eclipse.  The internal Eclipse browser should be hitting the same URL, so I don't know what could be different.  You might check the URL inside Eclipse and see if it's trying to hit something different.  The error log view might also have something interesting if you haven't checked there yet for this issue.

glad this is at least working directly from a browser so that you have a decent workaround,
j

label: Java Development
description:
Re: Eclipse Tutorial - Unable to run project
A Solution!! (I think)

I had the exact same problem, everything working fine locally but could get nothing to run on AmazonEC2. I too noticed from the shell log for catalina.out that tomcat wasn't started.

A day and a half later...

I found the problem to be my server runtime environment in eclipse when you set up the server. It was set as Apache Tomcat V 6.0, of course, but I was using the latest version (6.0.24) and this seems to be the problem. I downloaded an older version from the Tomcat archive (6.0.18) and added this when configuring runtime environments. Setting up an instance with this server runtime environment works!

I hope this helps anyone who stumbles along here.
But why does 6.0.24 not work!!?? Can this be fixed?

label: Java Development
description:
Re: Eclipse Tutorial - Unable to run project
Thanks for that !!  Yes I downgraded my local Tomcat as you suggested - I did mine to 6.0.16 from the archive and it worked first time!  I don't actually run it locally - just on EC2 but this defo sorts the issue!Guess more and more people will start getting this as the currect v6 Tomcat does not work - thank goodness they archive the older versions quite a way back!

label: Java Development
description:
Re: Eclipse Tutorial - Unable to run project
Hey Lemis,

We just released AWS Elastic Beanstalk last week (http://aws.amazon.com/elasticbeanstalk), which provides a really easy and highly configurable way to run Java web apps on AWS and have them automatically scale with load.

As part of that release, we did a big upgrade to the AWS Toolkit for Eclipse to support AWS Elastic Beanstalk.  We're still using all the same WTP tools in Eclipse, so your workflow shouldn't change much, but there is a new server type you can use: "AWS Elastic Beanstalk for Tomcat 6".

I'd definitely encourage you to try the new system; you should see much faster and more reliable performance now that AWS Elastic Beanstalk does all the heavy lifting.

There's a quick screencast showing the new Eclipse functionality here:
http://d1un85p0f2qstc.cloudfront.net/eclipse/elasticbeanstalk/index.html

and also a getting started guide for Eclipse here:
http://aws.amazon.com/articles/4412341514662386

Hope that helps!  Please try out the new tooling and let us know what you think.  It should be a big step up over the previous tooling in Eclipse,
j

description:
Re: New S3 AWS Mgmt Console is loading and loading and loading...
Hi Chris,

The S3 Console uses flash to talk to the S3 servers. This has been the case since the S3 console was first released. Given that the iPad doesn't have flash support, the S3 Console would have never been accessible from the iPad. 

As regards the folks having trouble loading the console, would you please provide the ID of the diagnostic report generated by the console test page, and we will investigate.

For those in corporate environments, we are working on a way for you to access the console without making any firewall changes. We will update this thread when new information pertinent to your access issues is available. 

Thanks,
Manoj

label: Java Development
description:
Re: Problems logging into AWS Management Console
Hi, danedanedane,

I'm sorry for the trouble you're having accessing this service.

Approval for your Amazon EC2 account is still pending. This usually happens when we're unable to verify your credit card details. Please update your payment information by following these steps:

1. Go to http://aws.amazon.com
2. Click on Account > Payment Method.
3. If prompted, sign in with your AWS account e-mail address and password.
4. Click "Edit this card" to update the expiration date or billing address for your current payment method, or select or enter a different payment method.

You'll receive a confirmation e-mail when your account is approved.

I hope this helps. We look forward to seeing you again soon.

Best regards,
Matthew P.

Michelle

label: Java Development
description:
Feedback on the Manamement Console
Hello,

I would like give you some Feedback on the AWS Management Console.

Bugs:

Instances: After launching a new instance the final "close" button in the dialog does not work. Only the closing button in the upper right corner works. After that, sometimes the "launch instance" button does not work any more.
Security Groups: It is not possible to add a new custom rule with protocol, port and group. Only predefined ones or custom but without group or custom with group but without specific protocol and port. The html form fields are always cleared by JavaScript.
Security Groups: When you add rule to group A, the switch to group B and then back to A it says "No records found."
Sometimes the navigation "AWS | Products | Developers ..." in the upper right corner shifts down to the tab "Amazon S3 | Amazon EC2 ...".
Account, Personal Information: The form does not work with special characters, e.g. München (Munich).


My browser is Chrome 7.

Apart from this it would be great to add multiple security groups to one instance.

First EC2 page after login: Not everyone is an American and using the default region. So why is it displayed always the first time? Even for people just using e.g. eu-west-1. It would be much better to see the actually used EC2 region first.

Best regards,
Bernd

Edited by: iblu on Nov 28, 2010 12:48 AM

label: Java Development
description:
Re: Feedback on the Manamement Console
Thanks for taking the time to give us feedback!  We will take a look and see what we can improve.

A couple things:

You can select any number of Security Groups in the Launch Instances Wizard (use cmd-click or alt-click on Security Groups).  

For custom Security Group rules, the Console only supports Group rules or protocol/port/cidr rules.
That is, if you specify another group in your rule, you are allowing instances in the target group full access to the instances in the allowing group.
Security Groups are a confusing topic, we hope to improve the UI for them in the future.

And finally, yes, the navigation (and other things) may compress in funny ways if the browser width is too narrow.

-Dave

label: Java Development
description:
Installing WorkDocs Companion on Microsoft Windows Server
Customers attempting to install Amazon WorkDocs Companion on Microsoft Windows Server may see their installation fail with an error message "The system administrator has set policies to prevent this installation". 

This is probably because of a software installation restriction policy in effect on Windows Servers. To enable the software install on Windows Server instances an Administrator has to set/create the "DisableMSI" registry key under HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\Installer] and set its value to 0 ("DisableMSI"=dword:00000000).

description:
workdocs storage
My Storage used is much higher than the total of the files actually stored in that folder.  Because of this I am now over my included storage allowance.

Please see attached screenshots which just show one folder as an example.  However, this happens on the majority of folders in my workdocs.  If anyone has any ideas I would be very grateful.

label: Java Development
description:
Re: workdocs storage
Hello chris125163,

My name is MD. I'm the GM for WorkDocs application.

Thanks for reaching out to us and sorry for the inconvenience this issue may have caused. As you may know WorkDocs supports unlimited versions of a file. Although each version of a file may only be a few gigabytes, you can quickly consume all your allocated storage if you create many versions of the file. Storage quota is controlled and applied by your site administrator/s.

You have two options:
1. Easiest: if you so wish, you could contact your administrator (WorkDocs web application: Tasks > New Task > Contact Administrator) and request an addition to your storage quota.

2. If you do not wish to keep all the previous versions of the file, please follow these steps:

Download the file to your local machine to a temporary location.
Delete it from the WorkDocs folders (this releases all storage associated with the file).
Upload the file (from your temporary location) back into WorkDocs.
Lastly, and this important: Lock the file in WorkDocs. This will ensure that while updates are made the file and uploaded to the cloud, new versions are not created for each update.


Hope this helps. Apologies for the inconvenience once again.

Thanks,
MD.
