label: Java Development
description:
Re: Web client upload issue
Hi,

I am MD, Sr. Manager in the WorkDocs team. I apologize for the inconvenience this issue may have caused to you.

This issue can occur in the following situations:
1. 
File Names and Lengths: WorkDocs supports Windows, Mac, iOS and Android platforms today. Unfortunately, all these platforms impose a variety of different restrictions on file names and lengths. WorkDocs, therefore, only allows names and lengths that are supported on all the platforms. If possible:
a) please rename the file 'Icon , Icon , Icon , Icon ...' to remove any special characters, like :/\ etc. 
b) shorten the name of the file.

2.
Intermittent networking issues: Sometimes, when uploading/downloading large number of files, any intermittent networking issue can result in failure to complete the operation. Please check and ensure that there are no disruptions in network connectivity during the uploads.

Follow up action items:
I will follow up with the team about improving the message to clearly indicate the failure and provide pointers to corrective actions.

Please let me know if you continue to find issues with uploading the files and I'll reach out to you offline to help resolve the matter.

Thanks,
MD.

label: Java Development
description:
Incorrect reporting of WorkDocs storage
The admin control panel is reporting incorrect storage for our users. I've been tracking the "Storage Used" for our users for the past month. 

All the storage numbers have remained static from May 9 until June 4. On June 4 our CTO's storage showed an increase of ~10GB, but everyone else remained static, including mine and I had uploaded a 4 GB file (among the other files that I have saved) to MyDocs earlier in May as a test, but my storage continues to show that I am using 30.89MB. 

I'm certainly not one to complain about free storage, but we'd prefer to not have a nasty surprise a few months down the road if it suddenly starts reporting things correctly. 

BTW I understand that all users get 1TB of storage, but our CTO in particular is concerned about running out of space as he set up our "Shared" file structure, so the assumption is that all items stored within that file structure will count toward his storage totals. (is this correct?)

Thanks for your time and if I can provide more information to clarify the issue, please let me know.

label: Java Development
description:
Re: Incorrect reporting of WorkDocs storage
Hello AmyL 

Thanks for using WorkDocs and for reporting the issue. There are a few aspects that needs to be clarified 1) Storage is calculated as a sum of all versions of files stored by the user 2) WorkDocs allows for unlimited versions of files to be stored by the user 3) Some files stored in WorkDocs will automatically have multiple versions if the application writing to these files performs frequent saves.  

You are correct in that if your CTO is hosting a set of files and folders that are shared thru out your organization, the storage usage is computed against his quota. That said you can easily increase the storage limits on a per user basis by editing the user profile and setting storage to a desired limit. Any storage used over 1 TB is charged at local S3 rates. See https://aws.amazon.com/workdocs/pricing/ for more details on pricing. 

Thanks again for using WorkDocs.

description:
WorkDocs Syncing Issues
Last summer we moved all files to WorkDocs.  Our office uses both Windows and Mac systems.  Although we have experienced syncing problems on both operating systems, the Macs seem to have the greatest difficulties.

My first question is simple . . . is there a way to force the sync client to sync?

At times the sync clients break and do not sync at all, but unfortunately most users are unaware the changes to their document have not been uploaded.  Multiply this issue among multiple users and this results in multiple versions of the same file stored locally on each computer with each user thinking other users have seen their edits.  This is a great problem that must be fixed.

When we realize a file does not sync, we always begin with a reboot of the computer.  At times when the entire sync app does not sync at all, a new test file is created and will at times kick start the syncing process, uploading the other changed files.  The test file however does not always work.

More recently, we are experiencing issues of individual files not syncing.  This is where the problems really compound as users can see from the sync history that files have been uploaded, so they assume all files have been uploaded.  This is not the case.

What is the best way to fix syncing problems?  What steps can be taken to verify a file has been synced.  Other cloud services provide some indicator when a file is in the process of syncing and then when it successfully or unsuccessfully completes.

Any help or advice is much appreciated.  Thank you!

label: Java Development
description:
Re: WorkDocs Syncing Issues
Hi JamesPinpoint:

Providing native access to Amazon WorkDocs files and folders in a reliable and consistent way is one of the key promise for Amazon WorkDocs. 
Over last year, we have made several improvements towards that,
1. For Windows users: We now offer WorkDocs Drive. It provides on-demand access to all files and folders natively in file explorer. It also provides visual badges for files and folders to exactly know when content is getting sync'd and when it is download. We are advising user's of WorkDocs to adopt WorkDocs Drive. More details on WorkDocs Drive can be found here - 
https://aws.amazon.com/about-aws/whats-new/2018/04/amazon-workdocs-drive-is-now-available-for-microsoft-windows-use/ 

2. We have also made changes to Sync client to address the reliability issues including improvements in Selective Sync functionality. More details can be found here - 
https://preview.blog.amazonworkdocs.com/updates/2017/07/21/new-and-improved-sync-client-experience.html

Let me know if your users are running into any issue currently? We would like to investigate and address it. I will also look into the initial issue reported by TredAdmin on April 3rd, 2017 to ensure that resolution was provided.

Thanks

Edited by: aws-hrshah on Jun 5, 2018 10:58 PM

label: Java Development
description:
Re: Drive "Shutdown due to error" and Finding status of "Report an Issue" ?
Hello chris916:

Thank you for providing the logs. We have confirmed that in your WorkDocs Recycle Bin, there are 100000 files. This is upper limit on allowed files in Recycle Bin. Due to that, when you are using WorkDocs Drive, any subsequent delete action is resulting in error.

To mitigate the issue:
You can review the content in WorkDocs Recycle Bin and empty the Recycle Bin ( OR selectively delete files ) if content is not needed. Note that deleted files will go to WorkDocs Admin's Recovery Bin. The Admin for WorkDocs can restore this content upto Retention policy period - https://docs.aws.amazon.com/workdocs/latest/adminguide/admin_dashboard_retention.html

Let us know if this resolves your issue with WorkDocs and Drive.

label: Java Development
description:
Re: Work docs Client Install
Hi Kevin:

It is certainly possible and that's one of the best practices that customers of WorkDocs follow.

For WorkDocs Drive - Admin can push the client install through SCCM and can specify the WorkDocs site-id as one of the parameters to MSI installer. This will make the client available to all the users pre-configured. Documentation is available here.
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/workdocs/latest/userguide/workdocs_drive_help.html#drive_install 

Additionally, for your enterprise, we would highly recommend to setup SSO with Active Directory of your organization. 

For Active Directory Integration to setup SSO, following are documented required setup:
Step 1: Enable SSO on the desired Directory ID as described in this article.- https://docs.aws.amazon.com/directoryservice/latest/admin-guide/single_sign_on.html

Please let us know if you have further questions. We can setup follow-up phone call as your schedule permits.

Thanks

description:
Re: Work docs Client Install

thanks

label: Java Development
description:
Re: Work docs Client Install
Hi Kevin:

WorkDocs Drive provides on-demand access to user's cloud data natively on Windows devices, without taking up local disk space or adding latency to data access. WorkDocs Drive will replace Sync client.

Following MSI options with your WorkDocs site-id from SCCM will perform unattend install for 800 users without user requiring to answer any questions.

“msiexec /I “AWSWorkDocsDriveClient.msi” SITEID=<your-site-id> REBOOT=REALLYSUPPRESS /norestart”

Are there specific scenarios for your users, that requires use of WorkDocs Sync client ?
WorkDocs Drive provides functionality parity with Sync client and additional features, i.e. Search, Share, Marking content as favorite as well as ability to Pause sync if n/w bandwidth is limited.
If there are requirements for your organization that are not met by WorkDocs Drive, we would like to understand and provide the mitigations.

WorkDocs Sync client is ClickOnce based installer, so does not have support for SCCM based install. We are also planning to replace Sync client in lieu of WorkDocs Drive.

Let us know,
Thanks

Edited by: aws-hrshah on May 8, 2018 12:27 PM

label: Java Development
description:
Re: Single user pricing confirmation
WorkDocs tracks storage consumption per user. So when a user exceeds their 1 TB storage limit WorkDocs will start computing the excess storage consumed and bill accordingly.

WorkDocs Drive - PC - Constant request for credentials

label: Java Development
description:
Re: WorkDocs Drive - PC - Constant request for credentials
Hello:

Thank you for being Amazon WorkDocs customer. 

If your organization is using Active Directory, Amazon WorkDocs support Single Sign-on (SSO) - so that user will not have to enter the credentials on periodic basis for WorkDocs Drive.
For Active Directory Integration to setup SSO, following are documented required setup:

Step 1: Enable SSO on the desired Directory ID as described in this article.- https://docs.aws.amazon.com/directoryservice/latest/admin-guide/single_sign_on.html 
Step 2: Enable SSO for Chrome/IE as described in this article.- https://docs.aws.amazon.com/directoryservice/latest/admin-guide/ie_sso.html 
Step 3: Step 3: Enable SSO for Firefox as described in this article.- https://docs.aws.amazon.com/directoryservice/latest/admin-guide/firefox_sso.html

We are also looking to improve the user experience for users that do not have SSO enabled. We will reach out to you to get additional details on your scenarios.

Thanks

Workdocs oauth
I'm prototyping an app that should read and write some files on Workdocs. I found docs for the Workdocs SDK itself, doc on how to initially grand access to the application by going to https://auth.amazonworkdocs.com/oauth?app_id=..., but I can't find the oauth endpoints to use in my code to get a token and refresh it. label: Java Development
description:
Re: Workdocs oauth
Hi Yan,
Thank you for reaching out to Workdocs.

The following document explains how to register and get authentication token programmatically from Workdocs: https://docs.aws.amazon.com/workdocs/latest/developerguide/wd-auth-user.html

Let us know if you have any further question.
Thanks,
Durgesh@aws

label: Java Development
description:
Re: Workdocs oauth
Hello Durgesh,

Thanks for tour reply !

Indeed, I used this document for the initial oauth setup : this allows the user to grant an application to perform operations using his account, in an interactive interface. At the end of it, I get an access token that works.
However, this token expires. OAuth provides means to refresh this token. This is non-interactive : as the user already gave his authorization, there is no need for him to fo through the "allow application to perform actions on your behalf" anymore.
I'm sure workdocs allows it because it's one of the core feature of oauth : once the user granted the rights, the application can perform tasks on his behalf in the background.

This is what I'm looking for, and this is not described in the article you pointed out. The only mention of "refresh" in that page is in the Java code snippet, but the override function is empty.

label: Java Development
description:
Re: Workdocs oauth
Hello 

Thanks for using WorkDocs. You are correct in that the WorkDocs SDK today supports Implicit Grant that is a needs re-authorization on token expiry. 

If you have a non-interactive application you can use SigV4, that will get one time authorization through IAM role/credentials and can be used till the authorization is revoked. 

Thanks and regards

label: Java Development
description:
Re: Workdocs oauth
Manoj how long does the token last before expiration?

Thanks,
Derek

label: Java Development
description:
Re: Docs owned by org
Hi Ryan,

Sorry for the delay in responding to you. Today, WorkDocs doesn't have a way to mimic a company shared drive that will show up as a network drive for the user. One solution could be for you, or the admin, to create a folder that hosts all the data you want to share, and a security group that includes all the users you want to include and give them an access to this folder. This folder will show up to users in "Shared with me" and they can browse it from the WorkDocs web client or from their File explorer/finder if they download the WorkDocs Sync client. 

We have heard similar feedback from other customers and we have in our backlog a work item to address this use case. 

Thank you
Mohsen

label: Java Development
description:
Re: How to delete an invited user from workdocs
Hello:

From WorkDocs Admin dashboard you can "deactivate" a user.
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/workdocs/latest/adminguide/admin_dashboard_cloud.html

Delete Users
Using the Amazon WorkDocs administration dashboard, you can only delete a cloud user that has not created their Amazon WorkDocs account yet. To delete one of these users, choose the trash can icon (  
trash can icon ) next to the user's name.

We do not recommend that you delete registered users. Instead, you should deactivate users, so they do not have access to your Amazon WorkDocs site. For more information about deactivating a user, see Edit Users.

You must always have at least one active user for your Amazon WorkDocs site. If you want to delete all users, you must delete your entire Amazon WorkDocs site.

description:

Yes you can use the underlying directory created for WorkMail for WorkDocs, where the same set of users can log in to both WorkDocs and Workmail using the same user credentials. label: Java Development
description:
Re: WorkMail & WorkDocs - Using Same Site Name?
When you let WorkMail create the directory for you, it creates an "IdentityPoolDirectory". Unfortunately, this directory is hidden from you if you've used the "Quick Setup" option. Not sure if AWS are able to change this for you, but it appears you cannot re-use this directory elsewhere.

Edited by: smcstewart on Jan 7, 2018 9:56 AM

label: Java Development
description:
Re: WorkMail & WorkDocs - Using Same Site Name?
yes you are correct - The Identity Pool directory created by WorkMail is for exclusive use by WorkMail only, and cannot be reused for WorkDocs. 

thanks

label: Java Development
description:
Re: Workdocs in production
hi HugoV

The use case you have outlined is fully supported by WorkDocs and should work like you intend it to. WorkDocs is an elastic service and will automatically scale to meet your requirements, without interrupting your usage within service defined SLAs.

Sync client requires a user's credentials to log into WorkDocs site, and today it cannot be easily configured to  run as a service. You can have a locked user session however where sync runs in the background and keeps files in sync with the service.

label: Java Development
description:
Issues Authenticating to WorkDocs Admin APIs using IAM credentials
I have been struggling with using the JavaScript API to performing other than a small subset of administrative functions. For example, using IAM credentials I am able to call the DescribeUsers API however my next step, to use the API for GetDocument fails with a permissions error.

My expectation of the fact this should work is based on two articles I had read regarding the WorkDocs APIs:

In the last paragraph on http://docs.aws.amazon.com/workdocs/latest/APIReference/Welcome.html the following is stated:

	All Amazon WorkDocs API actions are Amazon authenticated and certificate-signed. Use of the AWS SDK, but also allow for the exclusive use of IAM users and roles to help facilitate access, trust, and permission policies. By creating a role and allowing an IAM user to access the Amazon WorkDocs site, the IAM user gains full administrative visibility into the entire Amazon WorkDocs site (or as set in the IAM policy). This includes, but is not limited to, the ability to modify file permissions and upload any file to any user. This allows developers to perform the three use cases above, as well as give users the ability to grant access on a selective basis using the IAM model.

Further, on http://docs.aws.amazon.com/workdocs/latest/APIReference/API_GetDocument.html for the GetDocument API Reference, the description of the params include:

	AuthenticationToken
	Amazon WorkDocs authentication token. Do not set this field when using administrative API actions, as in accessing the API using AWS credentials.

Any insight would be greatly appreciated!

karldotm

label: Java Development
description:
Re: Issues Authenticating to WorkDocs Admin APIs using IAM credentials
Hello, I am from WorkDocs team and I am more than happy to assist you.

Because you are using IAM credentials (I am assuming you are initializing the client with access key ID and secret access key), you should not set AuthenticationToken in any of API calls.

Please make sure:

You are setting correct region in the client. The region must be where your WorkDocs site resides. If your client is able to call DescribeUsers on same WorkDocs instance, this implies your region is correct.
You are passing correct document ID. Document ID will be the one shown in browser's address bar while browsing a document.
Your IAM policy allows calling GetDocument API of WorkDocs service.


Please feel free to send a PM to me if you still need an assistance.

Thanks,
Mehmet.

label: Java Development
description:
Re: WorkDocs install problem
Hi Syd,

It appears as though you're encountering issues with configuration of ClickOnce Trust Prompt Behavior.

We have recently rolled out a new update (Windows v1.2.622.1) that replaces an expired authenticode code signing certificate we use to sign our WorkDocs Sync Client for Windows Installer and associated application binaries. This change looks to have triggered ClickOnce Trust Prompt Behavior on some customer Windows machines.

It is possible that this ClickOnce Trust Prompt Behavior configuration may have changed with an update to group policy if on a managed host, or the result of some other security related update/change.

This has been reported by some customers in the past and has been successfully remedied by making changes as detailed in the following documentation from Microsoft's MSDN site you can read here:

How to: Configure the ClickOnce Trust Prompt Behavior - https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ee308453.aspx

You will need to enable the ClickOnce Trust Prompt for Internet zone by having the value 'Enabled' or 'AuthenticodeRequired' set in order to have WorkDocs Sync Client for Windows be able to install/update.

Let me know if this solution works for you!

Cheers,
Phil.

label: Java Development
description:
Re: Windows Application install - Security Warning
Hi John,

It appears as though you're encountering issues with configuration of ClickOnce Trust Prompt Behavior.

We have recently rolled out a new update (Windows v1.2.622.1) that replaces an expired authenticode code signing certificate we use to sign our WorkDocs Sync Client for Windows Installer and associated application binaries. This change looks to have triggered ClickOnce Trust Prompt Behavior on some customer Windows machines.

It is possible that this ClickOnce Trust Prompt Behavior configuration may have changed with an update to group policy if on a managed host, or the result of some other security related update/change.

This has been reported by some customers in the past and has been successfully remedied by making changes as detailed in the following documentation from Microsoft's MSDN site you can read here:

How to: Configure the ClickOnce Trust Prompt Behavior - https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ee308453.aspx

You will need to enable the ClickOnce Trust Prompt for Internet zone by having the value 'Enabled' or 'AuthenticodeRequired' set in order to have WorkDocs Sync Client for Windows be able to install/update.

Cheers,

label: Java Development
description:
Re: Can workdocs be utilized for large external file transfers?
Hello 
Answers to your specific questions: 
1) Can workdocs be utilized for large external file transfers?
Yes WorkDocs can be used to share large files with external users, using Share a link Facility 

2) These file transfers must be secure and must be available for up to one year from the original posting.
We use SSL in the Web UI and Sync client for secure over the wire transfer; lifespan of the file is upto the user, meaning user can delete files when they wish 

3) I am wanting to be able to email an attorney some links that he can click on view and also download to their computer. I can load the web page when I send an external share link, but I am unable to download a .mov file, I have checked the naming convention but the download button doesn't do anything.
If you click on download a copy the MOV file should download unless you have explicitly disabled download for the file. 

Psl let us know if you continue to have issues. Thanks for using WorkDocs!

label: Java Development

Thank you for the question.
The token provided by OAuth flow will be valid for 1 hour only. After 1 hour, user will need to re-authenticate and grant access to the application.

label: Java Development
description:

Amazon workdocs allows users to save all versions of a document, and retrieve any saved version on demand. This should perhaps help with your reduplication scenarios. We do not currently have support for electronic signature.

label: Java Development
description:
Re: Billing Help - Cost Explorer, etc.
Hello,

There could be a number of reasons you're unable to find the resource causing the unexpected usage increase. First, I suggest reviewing the steps to find untagged resources here:

https://docs.aws.amazon.com/awsconsolehelpdocs/latest/gsg/scenario-finding-untagged.html

If still no luck, then the resources might not be something that can be tagged. Feel free to review the following page for details: 

https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/UserGuide/Using_Tags.html#tag-ec2-resources-table

If there are resources you know that cannot be tagged, that should help clue you into which ones are causing this. 

If you have any more questions please let us know by opening a Support Case in the Support Center. In that way, we can take a closer look at your account: 

http://amzn.to/aws-support-center

label: Java Development
description:
Re: Limit on ItemPages
Hello,

The Product Advertising API is not an Amazon Web Services product, though the Product Advertising API borrows the AWS Access Keys system as its method of authenticating API calls. 

The Amazon Associates team supports Affiliates like you in setting up and managing the API. Their documentation for working with the API can be found here:

https://affiliate-program.amazon.com/gp/advertising/api/detail/main.html

If you have any questions about your Amazon Associates account, or setting up and managing the Product Advertising API, you can contact the Associates team directly here:

https://affiliate-program.amazon.com/gp/associates/contact

Thanks,
-Mickey N

label: Java Development
description:
Can AWS open a GitHub issues page to complement this (clunky) forum?
It seems like these forums are fairly well attended to by AWS staff, which is a really good thing. I've found that AWS is remarkably responsive across the array of communication channels. 

However, this forum is so much clunkier than using a Github issues section and I think the quality of AWS products suffers for it. There are a lot of AWS services (like Batch or Cloud9) that have been around for a long time but still lack shockingly basic features or have horrible UX/UIs and these forums seem to be the only way to provide feedback on those services -- but these forums are not a good way to provide feedback, imo.

I had an issue with the AWS Batch service and I stumbled across an old thread with an old issue that still has not been fixed. It's completely understandable that issues might take a year or two to fix, but these forums don't provide the same type of insight that a Github Issues section does -- seeing that old thread feels like a dead end. (https://forums.aws.amazon.com/message.jspa?messageID=800954)

On Github, I could:
 - upvote the thread & individual posts
 - see how many other people have engaged with it (more than just page views)
 - gauge whether the issue is on the aws team's radar
 - reference the issue in another issue or find related issues/solutions
 - see if anybody is working on that issue
 - see if the issue has been resolved
 - see a rich discussion by aws staff and developers
 - be sure that it is not a duplicate issue
 - see how many other issues are in the backlog to gauge likelihood of a fix
The AWS team would also benefit from the rich feedback interface that Github provides.

Some teams in AWS do have their own github issues section (eg. the aws-sdk javascript team -- where there are 135 open issues + 1700 closed issues and issues are posted every day and responded to almost immediately). The aws-sdk team is fantastic to work with and I'm sure that the tight user feedback loop is responsible for the quality of aws-sdk.

Please consider opening a Github issues page (an empty repo) for each individual AWS service so that users/developers can provide general feedback in a rich issue-tracking environment.

Edited by: aidanjh on Jan 17, 2019 1:22 AM

label: Java Development
description:
AWS - Chime New Version - Missed Features
Hello:

I wanted to leave some feedback on the recent upgrade to Chime.  The newer version looks great, but there are two features that were changed that I would like to let you know that I a missing them since the change.

1) No Taskbar notification when user joins your meeting.  

On MAC I used to get an alert badge when someone joined my meeting, letting me know that the other party is on the bridge.  It no longer shows that notification, so its hard to tell if people have joined your call or not.  This was great for meetings with a few people where people might be 5-10 minutes late. I dont have to sit on the bridge and I got some form of an alert when people did join.  I'd love a notification that someone has joined my meeting when I have chime open, but have not joined the meeting yet.  A lot of times, we get caught up, and it would be nice to have the option for a popup, "Hey you are hosting a meeting and someone just joined and you are not there"

2) There is no longer a "quick" way to copy JUST your meeting link.  

While the update has a place to copy ALL the meeting info, most of the time (80%), I just want to copy the link quickly to post to people on chat or email and I want JUST the link, not the paragraph of other text that goes with it.  This feature was in the old version, but missing in the new.  The one click copy link was great.

label: Java Development
description:
Cannot See Cost Explorer Tags In Linked Account
I have a master account for billing and a couple of linked accounts for dev and test. I created an Owner tag on one of the EC2 instances in the master and one in the linked dev account (which is the one I am interested in), then activated it as per the docs.

I waited a couple of days and the Owner tag did then appear in the Cost Explorer of the master account for the tag I created on the master EC2 instance. It did not appear in the dev linked account Cost Explorer nor did the linked dev EC2 instance Owner tag appear in the master Cost Explorer.

It has been another couple of days since so I am fairly sure I have waited long enough for the dev tag to appear so I am assuming I have done something wrong or missed something out.

How do I make a linked account Cost Explorer tag work?

label: Java Development
description:
Re: Cannot See Cost Explorer Tags In Linked Account
Hi Dan, 

I'm sorry for any trouble caused by the tags not showing in the Cost Explorer. 

There are a few potential reasons this could occur. The Billing & Cost Management console will only display Cost Allocation Tags you create for your resources after you've enabled Detailed Billing Reports on your console. To enable these reports, navigate to the link below and check the box labeled "Receive Billing Reports":

https://console.aws.amazon.com/billing/home?/preferences#/preferences

Once you've enabled these reports, you'll need to manually activate the tags you want to track at this link:

https://console.aws.amazon.com/billing/home?#/preferences/tags

This link only appears once you've enabled Detailed Billing Reports on your console, so often the link will not be visible if those reports aren't enabled.

If you wanted to save some time and do the research on your own, I'd recommend checking out the following resources on best practices for applying tags:

https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/UserGuide/Using_Tags.html#tag-resources-for-billing

If the above doesn't do the trick, we'll be happy to take a closer look at your account. Feel free to get in touch with us in the Support Center:

http://amzn.to/aws-support-center

We're unable to provide specific account info here due to privacy reasons. Hope you'll understand.

Thanks,
-Mickey N

label: Java Development
description:
Re: Need to Separate AWS from Amazon.com consumer account

label: Java Development
description:
Re: Need to Separate AWS from Amazon.com consumer account
Hello, 

At this time you are correct, your Amazon.com and AWS Account can not be separated. We realize this is a pain-point and have sent the feedback to our development teams. 

In the future, a workaround you could use when setting up services is to create two separate accounts with different email addresses. 

Alternatively, to use the same email address you could add +aws to the email address. For example:

kitb@domain.com would be my Amazon.com account. 
kitb+aws@domain.com would be my AWS account. 

Any characters starting with the + and after are a sort of "ghost" and emails for my AWS account would still be directed to my regular email address. My login for AWS would require the +aws and it's individual password. 

If you're an existing customer, and are trying to do this, you would need to migrate the resources manually. 

I apologize for any inconvenience this causes, but appreciate your feedback. 

Kit B.

description:
Re: Need to Separate AWS from Amazon.com consumer account
Hi guys. Today I received this mail from support. Good news: Accounts starting from August 10, 2017 are not more affected by the auto connection. Bad news: Old Accounts are not migrated and it doesn´t look like any solution will come in the future. So for me I will start migrating manually.

Hello,

Thanks for reaching out to us about the recently announced changes to our AWS sign in experience.

Starting August 10, 2017, newly created AWS accounts will no longer be connected to the Amazon.com retail account system. These accounts will have AWS-specific login credentials that are independent from the retail Amazon.com system.

This new account registration system does not have any effect on the way customers access their account or navigate the AWS console; this is simply an administrative change in the way our system manages AWS accounts. For more information on this new system, see our Security blog here:

https://aws.amazon.com/blogs/security/coming-soon-improvements-to-how-you-sign-in-to-your-aws-account/

At this time, existing AWS accounts created before July 31 will not be migrated to this new system. Additionally, we do not have any option to manually migrate existing accounts to this system upon request. I'm sorry for any concern this may cause.

I hope this helps.

Best regards,

label: Java Development
description:
Re: Need to Separate AWS from Amazon.com consumer account
I found the following solution to this problem:

Create a new user in IAM and do the following:

• Give the new user admin permissions by attaching the "AdministratorAccess" and "Billing" policies.

• Set the user's security credentials such it can gain access to the account via a login password.

• Make note of the "Console login link" provided in the security credentials tab. That is the link to be used by the new admin user to login.

• Be sure to record the "secret access key" to a safe place since I don't think you get another opportunity to do so.

Now go to your AWS account settings and make the following changes:

• Scroll to section "IAM User and Role Access to Billing Information" and activate IAM access.

• Scroll to "Communication Preferences", click through, click "Profile", and then enter an appropriate email address that differs from your normal Amazon email address.

That's it. The new admin user's login credentials now provide full control over AWS, including billing, but without access to your personal Amazon account (order history, etc) or use of your original email address.

Note that this is not a perfect solution because I believe your personal Amazon account must continue to maintain control of your AWS resources. That is not a good situation from the perspective of a new owner of your AWS resources. However, the solution does make it easy to transfer AWS control to a new owner, and the new owner can then migrate your AWS resources to their own account on their own schedule.

I hope that helps.

label: Java Development
description:
Re: Need to Separate AWS from Amazon.com consumer account
I am living this hell right now.  An employee who left the company has root, but has over a decade of purchase history and digital content from amazon.com that makes just "handing it over" not an option. Hindsight of course, but you have to understand, especially with small companies, AWS usually goes from experimentation from a single developer, to one service, to a giant and complex architecture. It's common for developers to signup with an email that is attached to an amazon.com account. I'm lucky that the relationship is not hostile, and I still have an IAM account. 

If you're running a blog on a single ec2 machine this migration is annoying, but not difficult. Start throwing in r53, s3, cf, lambda, transcoder, alb with many targets, all acm certs, dns, launch templates, rds, elasticache, mobile hub with analytics, cognito identity pools,  IAM accounts and roles.... goooooooooooooood luck. 

With cloudformation, ansible, etc you may think it would be easy to fire up everything in a new account, which is true, but it's really not that easy when you're migrating a "in the wild" production environment and can't afford downtime.

https://docs.aws.amazon.com/awsaccountbilling/latest/aboutv2/ce-what-is.html

Another option to review previous usage costs would be to make use of the AWS Cost and Usage Report which is also helpful to dive into usage per service. label: Java Development
description:
Account Compromised - A Review of my Customer Journey
As a professional who takes a keen interest and works with clients as it relates to customer journeys, I thought I would detail my own as it related to my own security mistake and where it has taken me in the last 8 hours so far. 

My journey started over the last few weeks as I have been trying to create scripts to launch and subsequently configure EC2 instances for the purposes of installing and readying our company's software for initial use. This has meant that I have been making use of multiple AWS services: S3, EC2, EBS to name a few. I had created an Administrative Access Key to help in this process.

Initial Compromise and Re-securing Directions
Today, I was continuing to work on the same script and thought it might be a good idea to start putting these under some version control so I went to GitHub and like a fool, forgot to take my AWS key out of the file - big mistake.

Approximately, 30 mins later as I was still working in my AWS instance, I received two emails 6 mins apart notifying that something was very wrong in my account:

Subject: Action Required: Your AWS account 3403xxxxxxxx is compromised
Subject: Account Closure: Please Read

I had made the commit into Github ~ 30 mins prior to receiving these emails - the first email was received right at the moment  approximately 44 VERY large EC2 instances were spun up in my name. Both these emails put the fear of God into me. The emails themselves did a good job of directing me exactly what to do. In a few short mins, I removed the users, groups, roles that what I only can suspect was an automated script that continuously monitors GitHub for suckers like me. To Amazon's credit, my account was locked down within 6 mins of compromise. 

Initial Compromise and Re-securing Directions Grade: A+

Post Re-Securing Cleanup Journey
After re-securing my account, I needed to begin the process of finding what this exploit script left behind. This is where the customer journey takes a turn. I was informed that I should check all Amazon services to do so paying particular attention to EBS, S3, EC2, groups, roles, and users. Unlike a credit card company, there is no transaction history to return to see and find what might have been opened. In cases like this, it would be incredibly helpful to know what services were requisitioned and when as I can point out around the exact time the exploit script hit. Instead, I have hit most of the major services and I BELIEVE that at most this exploit script was interested in spinning up instances of EC2. That said, I'm not sure if you have gone through the Amazon catalog as of late, but there are literally hundreds of services across all the different regions and any of those could have been turned on and I likely won't know it until it hits my bill - in that case it will be a few hours behind, which isn't good for Amazon or me.

Additions that Would be Helpful in this Situation

A single list of services that are currently being used across each region
Even if I just had a quick dashboard that all services, across all regions where I could quickly see what was turned on and being used that would be super helpful to know where stuff was running.

A transaction list of items that had been turned on / used in the last day 
With this I could pinpoint the exact services that were currently on. Yes, I know this will come in my billing, but it would be nice if we didn't have to worry about it after it got billed.

Post Re-Securing Cleanup Journey Grade: C

Account Recovery and Getting Back to Normal

With all the fireworks and work that was done to get through the first 10 minutes of account compromise, this portion is the most disappointing and most opaque. Currently, I believe I have my account secured and ready to start work again, but I have no idea. The initial case that was setup said to respond, but the case file says it is still unassigned. In addition, my ability to requisition EC2 and EC2 spot instances are blocked effectively stopping any of my work at the moment. I understand the desire to have a human in the loop, but it would be helpful if there was an automated way that AWS could verify everything is in good working order. Even better, if I just had a complete "account reset" button that rolled back as if my account was brand new with being compromised, I would have gladly taken that route as I'm not really running anything myself at the moment that couldn't be rebuilt. Right now I'm dead in the water until I can get back to creating EC2 instances and I have no way of knowing if I have done everything I'm supposed to do (there is no checklist nor is there any timeline that has been shared).

Additions that Would be Helpful in this Situation






A reset all button for my account to take it back to brand new (only available if account appears to be compromised
A programmatic checklist that could scan changes made to an account in order to see if it meets expectations for recovery
A timeline or sense of timing of when account use can return to normal






Account Recovery and Getting Back to Normal Grade: D-

This is not to beat up on folks but potentially identify gaps in this process. Its not how I wanted to spend my Sunday afternoon, but it is what it is. It would be helpful if some of these suggestions could be incorporated so that others wouldn't have as bad an afternoon as me.

label: Java Development
description:

description:
Re: Free Tier alert for paid items.
Hello,

All services offered on the Free Tier have limits, and each service has a different type of limit. 
For example, the free tier covers the first 20,000 times you retrieve a file from Amazon S3, but you're charged for additional file retrievals. To find out more about each service and it's limit please visit this link: https://docs.aws.amazon.com/awsaccountbilling/latest/aboutv2/free-tier-limits.html.

This document provides info on tracking your AWS Free Tier usage to help you stay under the free tier limits: https://docs.aws.amazon.com/awsaccountbilling/latest/aboutv2/tracking-free-tier-usage.html.

If you'd like more billing support, feel free to visit this link to reach our support team: https://pages.awscloud.com/contact-us-account-support.html

Warm regards,
Amy J.

label: Java Development
description:
Re: Cannot filter by tags in Cost Explorer
Hi Jakob,

I just had the same problem and I found a solution.

1st, it seems the link just links to the case history in general, so you're not able to see the ticket of the OP but your own.
2nd, you need to enable cost tags to be able to use them.
activate cost allocation tags:
To activate your tags
   Sign in to the AWS Management Console and open the Billing and Cost Management console at >https://console.aws.amazon.com/billing/home#/.
   In the navigation pane, choose Cost Allocation Tags.
   Select the tag(s) that you want to activate.
   Choose Save.
Source: http://docs.aws.amazon.com/awsaccountbilling/latest/aboutv2/activating-tags.html

After you've enabled cost tags, you can choose which ones you want to activate. It took a while for me, the tags where available in cost explorer the next day.

Please have a look at this article for more info on how to have your tags created and available for use: https://docs.aws.amazon.com/awsaccountbilling/latest/aboutv2/configurecostallocreport.html#allocation-viewing

You can also reach out to our Account and Billing Support team for any other questions or guidance regarding this: https://console.aws.amazon.com/support/home

Kind regards,

description:
Can't connect to SQL Server 2014 Express AMI
Hello,

When I use the RDP session I only see one Command Prompt window.  I don't see a Windows UI.  Is this AMI bad?

Additionally, I'm trying to remotely connect to the SQL Server that is provided by this AMI.  I have all ports inbound ports open but I can't figure out how to remotely connect and configure it.  I can connect to it locally in the RDP session.

Is there a default port for this SQL instance?  

https://aws.amazon.com/marketplace/pp/B00KQP3H7W?qid=1550514839796&sr=0-8&ref_=srh_res_product_title#pdp-support

Thanks!

Zach

label: Java Development
description:
Re: Can't connect to SQL Server 2014 Express AMI
The AMI contains Windows Server Core Install : https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/hh846323(v=vs.85).aspx, so seeing only Command Prompt is expected.

By default the network services are disabled on SQL Server. Need to restart network services to be able to reach SQL Server (port 1443) from outside server.

Following is the way to enable the networking service:
1. Use netstat -a -b to verify port 1433 is not LISTENING
2. Run C:\Windows\SysWOW64\SQLServerManager12.msc from cmd.exe to open SQL Server 2014 Configuration Manager
3. Follow Steps in Microsoft Article   https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/sql/database-engine/configure-windows/enable-or-disable-a-server-network-protocol?view=sql-server-2017  to check the network status, enable, and restart SQL Server
4. After SQL Server restart, check for port status using netstat -a -b
5. Should be able to connect from other servers after that, off course assuming the port is allowed.

Hope this helps.

label: Java Development
description:
Is CustomerIdentifier always unique per user?
In the following guide (https://docs.aws.amazon.com/marketplace/latest/userguide/configuring-your-saas-application-to-accept-new-customers.html), ResolveCustomer is used to get CustomerIdentifier and ProductCode.

Is CustomerIdentifier is always associated to a single AWS user?

I.e. does CustomerIdentifier always mean an individual, or can it also resolve to an organization that individual belongs to? In other words, can two different AWS users ever have the same CustomerIdentifier?

Thank you,
Alex

label: Java Development
description:
Re: Is CustomerIdentifier always unique per user?
CustomerIdentifier is associated with a single AWS account. If multiple users share the same AWS account (through IAM roles, for example), yes, they will share the same CustomerIdentifier.

description:
AWS Status page improvement (JSON and CORS support)
I m using several cloud provider to operate my application and need to retrieve information from all my providers. To do that I use their “status page” like :
http://status.aws.amazon.com/
https://status.cloud.google.com/
…

I retrieve from them the list of incidents as a JSON stream. Here is the Example for google :
https://status.cloud.google.com/incidents.json

When I tried to do the same for AWS I run into several issue. First the JSON URL is hard to find so I think it should be added on the status page (see how google do it). 
After I find the JSON URL : http://status.aws.amazon.com/data.json I had error to retrieve data from it because of CORS.

It would be much easier if this page which is public and aim to distribute information allow CORS from all domain (like Google do with the CORS allow all header).

I hope AWS will take that into consideration to improve the experience for developers.

Cheers, Charles

label: Java Development
description:
Re: AWS Status page improvement (JSON and CORS support)
Here is the answer from the AWS engineer contacted through my company :

The JSON version of the AWS Status data that you found is actually an undocumented, internal API that the web page uses.
The official and supported programmatic way of getting AWS status information is to use the various RSS feeds that you see on the page to the right of the table entries.
As you can see, the RSS feed URLs follow a simple naming convention, so you don't need to copy paste them into a large table, instead, you can use any of the popular RSS feed parsers and a few for loops to cycle through all the regions and services that interest you and retrieve their status information.

I hope it can help some people.

label: Java Development
description:
Can't connect to SQL Server 2014 Express AMI
Hello,

When I use the RDP session I only see one Command Prompt window.  I don't see a Windows UI.  Is this AMI bad?

Additionally, I'm trying to remotely connect to the SQL Server that is provided by this AMI.  I have all ports inbound ports open but I can't figure out how to remotely connect and configure it.  I can connect to it locally in the RDP session.

Is there a default port for this SQL instance?  

https://aws.amazon.com/marketplace/pp/B00KQP3H7W?qid=1550514839796&sr=0-8&ref_=srh_res_product_title#pdp-support

Thanks!

Zach

label: Java Development
description:
Re: Can't connect to SQL Server 2014 Express AMI
The AMI contains Windows Server Core Install : https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/hh846323(v=vs.85).aspx, so seeing only Command Prompt is expected.

By default the network services are disabled on SQL Server. Need to restart network services to be able to reach SQL Server (port 1443) from outside server.

Following is the way to enable the networking service:
1. Use netstat -a -b to verify port 1433 is not LISTENING
2. Run C:\Windows\SysWOW64\SQLServerManager12.msc from cmd.exe to open SQL Server 2014 Configuration Manager
3. Follow Steps in Microsoft Article   https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/sql/database-engine/configure-windows/enable-or-disable-a-server-network-protocol?view=sql-server-2017  to check the network status, enable, and restart SQL Server
4. After SQL Server restart, check for port status using netstat -a -b
5. Should be able to connect from other servers after that, off course assuming the port is allowed.

Hope this helps.

label: Java Development
description:
Re: Can't connect to SQL Server 2014 Express AMI
Perfect response!  Thank you so much.  That's very helpful.

label: Java Development
description:
Is CustomerIdentifier always unique per user?
In the following guide (https://docs.aws.amazon.com/marketplace/latest/userguide/configuring-your-saas-application-to-accept-new-customers.html), ResolveCustomer is used to get CustomerIdentifier and ProductCode.

Is CustomerIdentifier is always associated to a single AWS user?

I.e. does CustomerIdentifier always mean an individual, or can it also resolve to an organization that individual belongs to? In other words, can two different AWS users ever have the same CustomerIdentifier?

Thank you,
Alex

label: Java Development
description:
Re: Is CustomerIdentifier always unique per user?
CustomerIdentifier is associated with a single AWS account. If multiple users share the same AWS account (through IAM roles, for example), yes, they will share the same CustomerIdentifier.

The security token included in the request is invalid - when done thru mac

I have a very strange problem.

I have an application with nodejs (talking to AWS) and Angularjs.

when I initialize the node application, aws-sdk uses my accessId and secretkey to get the token and session info. using that it will makes the remainder of the calls to dynamo/s3/sqs/ses. All this works very good on windows.

Now I ported the exact same application to mac (everything is same, code, keys) and I get a "The security token included in the request is invalid" error when trying to get session/token info.

I tried with 0.12 version of node and 0.10.36 and same error. below is the snippet from my console

Santhoshs-MacBook-Pro:NesterApp-Desktop santhoshML$ node app.js

init s3 wrapper

Listening on port 3000.

label: Java Development
description:
key pair in eclipse toolkit
Hi,I've setup the eclipse toolkit and it is listing my instance but the key pair has a big red 'x' next to its name.  I can also not connect to the instance via the eclipse toolkit. Everything works well in the aws console or elasticfox.  I have the keys in ~/.ec2/ in which they should be detected automatically. What am I missing?  How can I fix this?- Markus

label: Java Development
description:
Re: key pair in eclipse toolkit
Hey Markus,

that red 'x' definitely means the toolkit can't find your private key, just like you mentioned.  

There's two ways to take care of this:
 1 - ensure that the corresponding private keys live in ~/.ec2/ and that the file name is in the form "<key-name>.pem" .   It sounds like you've already got your keys in the right directory, so I'm guessing maybe they just have a different file extension?  Some private keys on windows/mac tend to use different extensions depending on which platform they're created for, so maybe the toolkit needs to be aware of that and accept other extensions, too.  If that's what's happening to you, i'll open a bug report so we can add that feature.

 2 - If you can get to EC2 Key Pair widget (in the Launch Wizard for example), you can right click on the key pair and click the "Select private key file" menu item to explicitly map a private key to a key pair.  I've got a change open to make it easier to get to that Key Pair widget from the preferences, but until that's submitted and built, you can find it on the Launch Wizard.

Let us know if that helps and if you have any other feedback,
j

label: Java Development
description:
Re: key pair in eclipse toolkit
go to Window->Preferences->AWS Toolkit->Key Pairs and associate the archive with the Key Pairs that you downloaded from amazon. Then A nice Check has to appear instead of the horrible red cross.

label: Java Development
description:
API restrictions
Hi there, I'm quite new here and I'm planning to use the SDK API to create my own console administration for my Amazon servers. 
I would like to control (launch, stop, etc) and monitor them (performance, errors, etc).  I know this is a too general question but is there any restriction in the API regarding to what I could do through the official console?

Thank you.

label: Java Development
description:
Re: API restrictions
Yes, it is a very broad question, but I would say that you can expect to find nearly everything around server management in the "raw" APIs. I believe the SDKs are relatively complete in general as well, with one exception: The AWS SDK for JavaScript in the Browser supports only a small number of services (that have CORS support).

label: Java Development
description:
Re: How long should it take to get a new EC2 account?
Hello,

Account and service activation usually takes just a few minutes, but can take up to 24 hours in some cases. For security reasons we do not provide account specific details in the public forums. If activation of your account takes longer than 24 hours, you'll need to contact AWS Customer Service for assistance.

http://aws.amazon.com/contact-us/

label: Java Development
description:
Re: rds-download-db-logfile
Hey,

403 is an authentication error.

I had the same problem, and what worked for me is setting the region variable in my .bashrc file, in my case eu-west-1b:
export EC2_REGION=eu-west-1b


Also, don't forget to create your credentials file.

For more information you can see AWS's guide:
http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonRDS/latest/CommandLineReference/StartCLI.html

description: Help with Creating API URL Signature I'm having bad luck with creating Signature to talk to EC2 REST API and keep on receiving the message SignatureDoesNotMatch. The request signature we calculated does not match the signature you provided. Check your AWS Secret Access Key and signing method. Consult the service documentation for details. Here are the Strings I created and URLS: The Secret Key used is : DBAmtf3HmA/IdC6MykY+xKNOZ6D/1ZBwABQli3kR Key ID : A K I A I G T A 3 O 2 Z 7 Z U E Q M W Q (without space) (This key pair is now deleted) HmacSHA1 Test: GET ec2.amazonaws.com /  AWSAccessKeyId=AKIAIGTA3O2Z7ZUEQMWQ&Action=DescribeInstances&SignatureMethod=HmacSHA1&SignatureVersion=2&Timestamp=2013-02-04T22:16:03&Version=2012-04-01 http://ec2.amazonaws.com/?Action=DescribeInstances&AWSAccessKeyId=<Access Key Removed>&SignatureMethod=HmacSHA1&SignatureVersion=2&Timestamp=2013-02-04T22:16:03&Version=2012-04-01&Signature=koQC%2BNmV7nKDEf2htQfGV6q2gl0%3D HmacSHA256 Test: GET ec2.amazonaws.com /  AWSAccessKeyId=AKIAIGTA3O2Z7ZUEQMWQ&Action=DescribeInstances&SignatureMethod=HmacSHA256&SignatureVersion=2&Timestamp=2013-02-04T22:16:48&Version=2012-04-01 http://ec2.amazonaws.com/?Action=DescribeInstances&AWSAccessKeyId=<Access Key Removed>&SignatureMethod=HmacSHA256&SignatureVersion=2&Timestamp=2013-02-04T22:16:48&Version=2012-04- 01&Signature=QjU2MUM0MUQ5RDE3QzdCRDk4RUFERUVFM0IzQTgwMDU5OTRGMzEyNjUxNjYzMkJFMDQ4MkIwMTYyN0FBN0MwNg%3D%3D 1) I'm not sure is my Signature string (before hashing ) is correctly formatted. If any of you can post a correct sample string that you used on ec2, it would be really helpful. 2) Even though my HMAC encryptions are theoretically correct, I'm not sure exactly how Amazon use it. For example HmacSHA256 string I use (before convert to Base64) is upper case. Do Amazon use lower case? 3. I published a sample key pair above, if any of you have a working function could you please encode a string using above string and publish here? That way I have something to work on and would be really helpful. Thank You! Sam Edited by: sam_content on Feb 4, 2013 2:44 PM Edited by: sam_content on Feb 4, 2013 2:45 PM

label: Java Development
description:
Re: Help with Creating API URL Signature
fixed. Exact format is something looks like this
GET
ec2.amazonaws.com
/ 
AWSAccessKeyId=AKIAJH43UFXANDWWWL6A&Action=DescribeInstances&SignatureMethod=HmacSHA256&SignatureVersion=2&Timestamp=2013-02-05T03%3A44%3A38&Version=2012-04-01


Timestamp encoding was the problem. ":" need convert into "%3A" but "-" remains as "-". So it is not full url encode, only encode some charters.
